if the Authority is satisfied that variation (or termination) cannot be achieved by agreement within a reasonable time,

P2para.Text: by order vary (or terminate) the section 104 agreement.
If an order under subsection (1) is made in relation to a section 104 agreement, the agreement—

P3para.Text: has effect subject to the provision made by the order, or
ceases to have effect, as the case may be.

P2para.Text: An order under subsection (1) may require any party to the agreement to pay compensation to any other party.
Neither the CMA nor the Authority may exercise, in respect of an agreement to vary or terminate a section 104 agreement, the powers conferred by—

P3para.Text: section 32 of the Competition Act 1998 (directions in relation to agreements);
section 35(2) of that Act (interim directions).

P2para.Text: Subsection (4)(b) does not apply to the exercise of powers in respect of conduct—

P3para.Text: which is connected with an agreement to vary or terminate a section 104 agreement, and

in respect of which section 35(1) of the Competition Act 1998 applies because of an investigation under section 25 of that Act relating to a suspected infringement of the Chapter 2 prohibition imposed by section 18(1) of that Act.

P2para.Text: In exercising its functions under this section, the Authority must have regard to the expenses incurred by the sewerage undertaker in complying with its obligations under the section 104 agreement in question and to the desirability of—

P3para.Text: facilitating effective competition within the sewerage services industry;
the recovery by the sewerage undertaker of the expenses of complying with its obligations by virtue of this section and securing a reasonable return on its capital;

the ability of the sewerage undertaker to meet its existing obligations, and likely future obligations, to provide sewerage services without having to incur unreasonable expenditure in carrying out works;
not putting at risk the ability of the sewerage undertaker to meet its existing obligations, or likely future obligations, to provide sewerage services.

P2para.Text: In this section and sections 105ZC to 105ZH “section 104 agreement” means an agreement with a sewerage undertaker for the vesting of a sewer, drain or sewage disposal works in a sewerage undertaker at a future date or on a future event and includes—

P3para.Text: an order under section 105ZA which is deemed to be an agreement by virtue of section 105ZA(5), and
any agreement which has been varied by order under subsection (1).

P1group.Title: Codes in respect of section 104 agreements

P2para.Text: The Authority may issue one or more codes in respect of section 104 agreements.
A code may make provision about—

P3para.Text: procedures in connection with making an agreement under section 104;
procedures in connection with varying or terminating a section 104 agreement;
procedures to be followed by the Authority in determining whether to make an order under section 105ZA(4) or 105ZB(1);
the circumstances in which it is, or is not, appropriate for work to be done by a person other than a sewerage undertaker;
the terms and conditions of a section 104 agreement;
principles for determining the terms and conditions that should or should not be incorporated into a section 104 agreement;
the steps to be taken by the Authority in determining whether a person is complying with a code.

P2para.Text: Provision under subsection (2)(d) may include in particular provision about circumstances relating to—

P3para.Text: the nature of the work;
the kind of premises supplied or to be supplied.

P2para.Text: Provision under subsection (2)(e) may include in particular provision about terms and conditions as regards—

P3para.Text: constructing associated infrastructure;
vesting associated infrastructure in a sewerage undertaker;
making a communication with public sewers.

P2para.Text: If the Authority considers that a sewerage undertaker is not acting as required by a code, the Authority may give the undertaker a direction to do, or not to do, a particular thing specified in the direction.
The Authority may not give a direction under subsection (5) requiring a person to enter into, vary or terminate an agreement.
It is the duty of a sewerage undertaker to comply with a direction under subsection (5), and this duty is enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
A code may make different provision for different persons or descriptions of person.
The Authority may from time to time review a code issued under this section and issue a revised code.
A revised code may include provision for applying any of its revisions to section 104 agreements made before the revised code comes into force.
Before issuing a code under section 105ZC, the Authority must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed code under section 105ZC, and
consult such persons about the proposed code as it considers appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Authority must specify the period (“the consultation period”) within which a person may make representations about the proposed code.
Before a code under section 105ZC prepared by the Authority is issued, the Minister may direct the Authority—

P3para.Text: not to issue the code, or
to issue the code with specified modifications.

P2para.Text: Subsection (3) is subject to subsections (6) and (7).
In subsection (3) “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, in relation to sewerage undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England;
the Welsh Ministers, in relation to sewerage undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales.

P2para.Text: The power under subsection (3) may not be exercised more than once by the Secretary of State or the Welsh Ministers.

If the power under subsection (3) is not exercised by the Secretary of State or the Welsh Ministers on the first occasion on which it may be exercised by the Secretary of State or (as the case may be) the Welsh Ministers, it may not be exercised by the Secretary of State or (as the case may be) the Welsh Ministers on a later occasion.

A direction under subsection (3) must be given within the period of 28 days beginning with the day after the end of the consultation period, and a code in relation to which a direction may be given may not be issued before that period of 28 days has expired.
This section is subject to section 105ZE.

P1group.Title: Codes under section 105ZC: minor or urgent revisions

P2para.Text: This section applies if the Authority proposes to issue a revised code under section 105ZC and, in the view of the Authority, the revision or each of the revisions proposed to be made is—

P3para.Text: a revision for which consultation is unnecessary, or
a revision that it is necessary or desirable to make without delay.

P2para.Text: Section 105ZD does not apply to the proposed revised code.
Once the Authority has issued the revised code, it must give notice as soon as reasonably practicable of—

P3para.Text: the issuing of the revised code, and
as regards each revision contained in it, whether in the view of the Authority the revision falls within paragraph (a) or (b) of subsection (1).

P2para.Text: Notice under subsection (3) is to be given to such persons as the Authority considers appropriate.

Unless the Authority gives notice that a revision in a revised code is in the view of the Authority a revision falling within subsection (1)(a), the revision ceases to have effect at the end of the period of six months beginning with the day after that on which the revised code is issued.

P1group.Title: Rules about charges in connection with a section 104 agreement

P2para.Text: The Authority may issue rules about charges that may be imposed by a sewerage undertaker under a section 104 agreement.
The rules may in particular specify—

P3para.Text: what types of charge may be imposed;
the amount or the maximum amount, or a method for determining the amount or maximum amount, of any type of charge;
principles for determining what types of charge may or may not be imposed;
principles for determining the amount of any charge that may be imposed.

P2para.Text: If the Authority considers that a sewerage undertaker is not acting as required by rules under this section, the Authority may give the undertaker a direction to do, or not to do, a particular thing specified in the direction.
It is the duty of a sewerage undertaker to comply with a direction under subsection (3), and this duty is enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
A code may make different provision for different sewerage undertakers or descriptions of undertaker.
The Authority may from time to time review rules issued under this section and issue revised rules.
Revised rules may include provision for applying any of their revisions to section 104 agreements made before the revised rules come into effect.
Before issuing rules under section 105ZF, the Authority must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of any proposed rules, and
consult the relevant persons about the draft.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the Welsh Ministers;
the Council;
any sewerage undertakers or other persons likely to be affected by the rules;
such other persons as the Authority thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Authority must have regard to guidance issued under section 105ZH in making rules under section 105ZF.
The Minister may issue guidance as to the content of rules under section 105ZF.
Before issuing the guidance, the Minister must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed guidance;
consult the relevant persons about the draft.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the Welsh Ministers;
such other persons as the Minister thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Minister may from time to time revise the guidance and issue revised guidance.
Subsections (2) and (3) apply to revised guidance as they apply to the original guidance.
The Minister must arrange for the publication of guidance issued under this section.
In this section “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, in relation to sewerage undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England;
the Welsh Ministers, in relation to sewerage undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales.

P2para.Text: In section 107 (right of sewerage undertaker to undertake the making of communications with public sewers), after subsection (1) there is inserted—
A sewerage undertaker may not give notice to a person under subsection (1) if—

P3para.Text: the undertaker and the person entered into an agreement under section 104, and
the agreement provides for the communication to which the person’s proposal relates to be made by the person.

P2para.Text: In section 108 (communication works by person entitled to communication), in subsection (1), after “section 106 above” there is inserted “or may not make such an election because of section 107(1A)”.

Pblock.Title: Arrangements for water undertakers to take water

P1group.Title: Arrangements for water undertakers to take water from other persons

P1para.Text: In Part 3 of the Water Industry Act 1991, after Chapter 2A there is inserted—

P1group.Title: Arrangements for water undertakers to take water from other persons

P2para.Text: The Minister may by regulations make provision about the supply of water to a water undertaker by a person other than a water undertaker.
Regulations under this section may, in particular—

P3para.Text: confer functions on the Authority, the Secretary of State and the Welsh Ministers;
make provision preventing the CMA or the Authority from exercising powers under the Competition Act 1998 in respect of a water supply agreement;
include provision described in sections 66N and 66O.

P2para.Text: In this Chapter—

Para.Text: “the Minister” means—
the Secretary of State, in relation to the supply of water to a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England, and
the Welsh Ministers, in relation to the supply of water to a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales;
“relevant person” means a person other than a water undertaker;
“water supply agreement” means an agreement for the supply of water to a water undertaker by a relevant person.

P1group.Title: Orders in respect of supplies by relevant persons

P2para.Text: Regulations under section 66M may, in particular, make provision for the Authority by order—

P3para.Text: to require a water undertaker to take a supply of water from a relevant person, and
to vary or terminate a water supply agreement.

P2para.Text: Provision made under subsection (1)(a) must provide that—

P3para.Text: the Authority may make an order only on an application by the water undertaker or the relevant person, and
before making an order the Authority must be satisfied that the water undertaker and the relevant person cannot reach agreement.

P2para.Text: Provision made under subsection (1)(b) must provide that the Authority may make an order only on an application by a party to the agreement.
The provision that may be made under subsection (1) includes—

P3para.Text: provision about the circumstances in which the Authority may make an order;
provision requiring the Authority to have regard to whether a person has complied with a code or rules described in section 66O;
provision enabling the Authority to specify the times at which, the period during which and the terms and conditions on which the supply of water must be taken;

provision for an order made by the Authority requiring a supply of water to be taken to have effect as an agreement between the water undertaker and the relevant person (or those persons and other persons);
provision requiring a party to a water supply agreement to pay compensation to another party on the variation or termination of the agreement.

P1group.Title: Codes and rules in respect of water supply agreements

P2para.Text: Regulations under section 66M may, in particular, make provision for the Authority to issue one or more codes in respect of water supply agreements, including—

P3para.Text: provision for a code to include provision about procedures in connection with making, varying or terminating a water supply agreement;
provision for a code to include provision about the terms and conditions of water supply agreements;
provision for a code to include provision about procedures to be followed by the Authority in determining whether to make an order described in section 66N;
provision for the Authority to direct water undertakers to comply with a code;
provision for such directions to be enforceable by the Authority under section 18;
provision for the Minister to require a code to be revised or to prevent a code being issued or revised (but see subsection (3)).

P2para.Text: Regulations under section 66M may, in particular, make provision for the Authority to issue and enforce rules about charges that may be imposed under water supply agreements, including—

P3para.Text: provision for the making of rules about the amount or maximum amount of a charge;
provision for the Authority to direct water undertakers to comply with the rules;
provision for such directions to be enforceable by the Authority under section 18;
provision for the Minister to issue guidance as to the content of the rules (but see subsection (3));
provision for the Minister to require rules to be revised or to prevent rules being issued or revised (but see subsection (3)).

P2para.Text: Functions conferred by provision described in subsection (1)(f) or (2)(d)or (e) must be conferred on the Secretary of State and the Welsh Ministers acting jointly so far as the code, guidance or rules relate to—

P3para.Text: a supply of water to a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England by means of the supply system of a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales;
a supply of water to a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales by means of the supply system of a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England.

P2para.Text: References in this section to a water undertaker’s supply system are to be construed in accordance with section 17B.
A statutory instrument containing regulations under section 66M may not be made unless a draft of the instrument has been laid before and approved by a resolution of—

P3para.Text: each House of Parliament, in the case of regulations made by the Secretary of State, or
the Assembly, in the case of regulations made by the Welsh Ministers.

P2para.Text: Before laying a draft of an instrument in accordance with subsection (1), the Minister must consult—

P3para.Text: the Authority,
water undertakers,
water supply licensees,
the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water,
the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water for Wales if there is one,
the Environment Agency,
the NRBW,
the Council, and
such other persons as the Minister considers appropriate.

P2para.Text: The supplemental and consequential provision that regulations under section 66M may include by virtue of section 213(2)(f) includes provision amending, repealing or revoking provision made by or under an enactment.
Section 213 applies to regulations made by the Welsh Ministers under section 66M as it applies to regulations made by the Secretary of State.

If a draft of an instrument containing regulations under section 66M would, apart from this subsection, be treated for the purposes of the Standing Orders of either House of Parliament as a hybrid instrument, it is to proceed in that House as if it were not a hybrid instrument.
In this section “enactment” includes a Measure or Act of the National Assembly for Wales.

P1group.Title: Procedure with respect to inset appointments

P2para.Text: Section 8 of the Water Industry Act 1991 (procedure with respect to appointments and variations replacing relevant undertakers) is amended as follows.
In subsection (2)(a) (the Water Services Regulation Authority to serve notice of application), for “on the existing appointee the NRA and on every” there is substituted “on—

P4para.Text: the existing appointee,
if the application relates to the replacement of a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England, the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water,

if the application relates to the replacement of a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales, the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water for Wales if there is one, or the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water if section 86(1B)(b) applies,
the appropriate agency, and
every

P2para.Text: In subsection (4)(b) (the Secretary of State or the Water Services Regulation Authority to serve notice of proposed appointment or variation), for “on the existing appointee the NRA and on every” there is substituted “on—

P4para.Text: the existing appointee,
if the proposed appointment or variation would replace a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England, the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water,

if the proposed appointment or variation would replace a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales, the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water for Wales if there is one, or the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water if section 86(1B)(b) applies,
the appropriate agency, and
every

P2para.Text: In subsection (5)(b) (the Secretary of State or the Water Services Regulation Authority to serve notice of the making of an appointment or variation), for “on the NRA and on every” there is substituted “on—

P4para.Text: if the appointment or variation replaces a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England, the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water,

if the appointment or variation replaces a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales, the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water for Wales if there is one, or the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water if section 86(1B)(b) applies,
the appropriate agency, and
every

P2para.Text: After subsection (6) insert—
In this section “the appropriate agency”, in relation to the replacement of a relevant undertaker, means—

P3para.Text: the Environment Agency, if the undertaker’s area is wholly in England;
the NRBW, if the undertaker’s area is wholly in Wales;
both the Environment Agency and the NRBW, if the undertaker’s area is partly in England and partly in Wales.

Pblock.Title: Duty of CMA to refer mergers of relevant undertakers

P1group.Title: Exceptions to duty and undertakings in lieu of merger references

P2para.Text: In section 32 of the Water Industry Act 1991 (duty to refer merger of water or sewerage undertaking), for “Subject to section 33 below,” there is substituted “Subject to sections 33 and 33A below,”.
After section 33 (exclusion of small mergers) there is inserted—

P1group.Title: Exceptions to duty to make reference

P2para.Text: The CMA may decide not to make a merger reference under section 32 as regards a case falling within section 32(a) if it believes that—

P3para.Text: the arrangements concerned are not sufficiently far advanced, or are not sufficiently likely to proceed, to justify the making of a merger reference;
the prospective merger is not likely to prejudice the ability of the Authority, in carrying out its functions by virtue of this Act, to make comparisons between water enterprises; or
the prospective merger is likely to prejudice that ability, but the prejudice in question is outweighed by relevant customer benefits relating to the merger.

P2para.Text: The CMA may decide not to make a merger reference under section 32 as regards a case falling within section 32(b) if it believes that—

P3para.Text: the merger has not prejudiced and is not likely to prejudice the ability of the Authority, in carrying out its functions by virtue of this Act, to make comparisons between water enterprises; or
the merger has prejudiced or is likely to prejudice that ability, but the prejudice in question is outweighed by relevant customer benefits relating to the merger.

P2para.Text: Before forming a view as to the matters in subsection (1)(b) or (c) or (2)(a) or (b), the CMA must—

P3para.Text: request the Authority to give an opinion under section 33B, and
consider that opinion.

P2para.Text: The CMA may not make a merger reference under section 32 if—

P3para.Text: it is considering whether to accept an undertaking under section 33D instead of making such a reference; or

it is prevented by section 74 of the Enterprise Act 2002 (effect of accepting an undertaking in lieu), in a case where that section as applied by paragraph 1 of Schedule 4ZA may have effect to prevent such a merger reference.

P2para.Text: In this section “relevant customer benefit” has the meaning given by paragraph 7 of Schedule 4ZA.
Where the CMA makes a request under section 33A(3), the Authority must give its opinion on—

P3para.Text: whether and to what extent the actual or prospective merger has prejudiced or is likely to prejudice the Authority’s ability, in
carrying out its functions by virtue of this Act, to make comparisons between water enterprises, and

where it forms the view that the actual or prospective merger has prejudiced or is likely to prejudice that ability, whether the prejudice in question is outweighed by any relevant customer benefits relating to the merger.

P2para.Text: In forming an opinion on the matters in subsection (1), the Authority must apply the methods set out in the statement under section 33C that has effect when the request under section 33A(3) is made.

In this section “relevant customer benefit” has the meaning given by paragraph 7 of Schedule 4ZA, except that references in paragraph 7 to what the CMA believes are to be read for the purposes of this section as references to what the Authority believes.
The Authority must prepare and keep under review a statement of the methods to be applied in forming an opinion on the matters in section 33B(1).
The statement must in particular set out—

P3para.Text: the criteria to be used for assessing the effect of any particular water enterprise ceasing to be a distinct enterprise on the Authority’s ability, in carrying out its functions by virtue of this Act, to make comparisons between water enterprises;
the relative weight to be given to the criteria.

P2para.Text: Before preparing or altering the statement, the Authority must consult—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State,
the Welsh Ministers,
the CMA, and
relevant undertakers.

P2para.Text: The Authority must from time to time publish the statement as it has effect for the time being.
After section 33C (inserted by subsection (2)) there is inserted—

P1group.Title: Undertakings in lieu of a merger reference

P2para.Text: If the CMA considers that it is under a duty to make a merger reference under section 32, it may instead of making such a reference accept undertakings to take such action as it thinks appropriate from such of the parties concerned in the actual or prospective merger as it considers appropriate.

The power under subsection (1) is to be exercised for the purpose of remedying, mitigating or preventing the prejudicial effect on the Authority’s ability, in carrying out its functions by virtue of this Act, to make comparisons between water enterprises that the actual or prospective merger has had, may have had or may be likely to have.
In forming a view for the purposes of subsection (1) as to whether it is under a duty to make a merger reference under section 32, the CMA—

P3para.Text: is to disregard the effect of section 33A(4)(a), but
is to take into account the powers under section 33A(1) and (2) to decide not to make a merger reference.

P2para.Text: In proceeding under subsection (1), the CMA must, in particular, have regard to the need to achieve as comprehensive a solution as is reasonable and practicable to the prejudicial effect on the Authority’s ability, in carrying out its functions by virtue of this Act, to make comparisons between water enterprises.
In proceeding under subsection (1), the CMA may, in particular, have regard to the effect of any action on any relevant customer benefits in relation to the actual or prospective merger.
Before deciding whether or not to accept an undertaking under this section, the CMA must—

P3para.Text: request the Authority to give its opinion on the effect of the undertakings offered, and
consider the Authority’s opinion.

P2para.Text: Where the CMA makes a request under subsection (6), the Authority must give its opinion on the effect of the undertakings offered.
An undertaking under this section—

P3para.Text: comes into force when accepted;
may be varied or superseded by another undertaking under this section;
may be released by the CMA.

P2para.Text: An undertaking under this section ceases to be in force if an order under section 75 or 76 of the Enterprise Act 2002 (powers to make an order where an undertaking is not fulfilled) is made, in a case where that provision of the Enterprise Act 2002 as applied by paragraph 1 of Schedule 4ZA may have effect in relation to such an undertaking.
The CMA must consider any representations received by it in relation to varying or releasing an undertaking under this section as soon as reasonably practicable.

In this section “relevant customer benefit” has the meaning given by paragraph 7 of Schedule 4ZA, except that references in paragraph 7 to what the CMA believes are to be read for the purposes of subsection (7) as references to what the Authority believes.

P1group.Title: Exclusion of small mergers: advice of CMA on threshold

P1para.Text: In section 33 of the Water Industry Act 1991 (exclusion of small mergers from the duty to make a merger reference under section 32), after subsection (6) there is inserted—

P2para.Text: The CMA must—

P3para.Text: keep under review the conditions set out in subsection (1)(a) and (b), and
from time to time advise the Secretary of State as to whether the conditions in subsection (1)(a) and (b), and the sums mentioned in those paragraphs, are still appropriate.

P2para.Text: In section 143 of the Water Industry Act 1991 (charges schemes), for subsections (6) to (9) (charges scheme not to take effect until approved by the Water Services Regulation Authority, etc), there is substituted—
If the Authority considers that a relevant undertaker’s charges scheme does not comply with—

P3para.Text: subsection (2), (3) or (5),
regulations under section 143A,
rules under section 143B, or
section 144A(9), (10) and (11)(a),

P2para.Text: the Authority may give the undertaker a direction to do, or not to do, a thing specified in the direction.
It is the duty of a relevant undertaker to comply with a direction under subsection (6), and this duty is enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
After section 143A there is inserted—
The Authority may issue rules about charges schemes under section 143.
Rules under this section may in particular—

P3para.Text: make provision about the types of charges that may be imposed;
make provision about the amount or maximum amount, or the methods for determining the amount or maximum amount, of any type of charge;
make provision about the principles for determining what types of charges may or may not be imposed;
make provision about principles for determining the amount of any change that may be imposed;
require particular schemes of charges to be available in specified cases;
make provision about the timing of payment of charges;
require charges schemes to be published;
make provision about how charges schemes are to be published.

P2para.Text: The rules may provide for the reduction of charges under a charges scheme where conditions specified by the rules are satisfied.
Rules made by virtue of subsection (3) may in particular specify conditions about—

P3para.Text: taking steps for the purpose of reducing or managing water consumption;
taking steps for the purpose of reducing or managing the discharge of matter from premises;
taking steps for the purpose of reducing the volume of surface water entering public sewers or the rate at which it does so.

P2para.Text: The provisions of charges schemes must comply with rules issued under this section.
The rules may make different provision for different cases, including different provision in relation to different, or different descriptions of, persons, circumstances or localities.
The power to make rules under this section may not be exercised for the purpose of limiting the total revenues of relevant undertakers from charges fixed by or in accordance with charges schemes.
The Authority may from time to time review the rules issued under this section and issue revised rules.
Revised rules may include provision for applying any of their revisions to charges schemes under section 143 made before the revised rules come into effect.

The Authority must have regard to guidance issued under section 143D in making rules under section 143B (as well as to any guidance issued under section 43 or 44 of the Flood and Water Management Act 2010).
Before issuing rules under section 143B, the Authority must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed rules, and
consult the relevant persons about the draft.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the Welsh Ministers;
the Council;
any relevant undertakers likely to be affected by the rules;
such other persons as the Authority thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Authority must specify the period (“the consultation period”) within which a person may make representations about the proposed rules.
Before rules under section 143B prepared by the Authority are issued, the Minister may direct the Authority—

P3para.Text: not to issue the rules, or
to issue them with specified modifications.

P2para.Text: In subsection (5) “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, so far as the rules in question affect relevant undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England;
the Welsh Ministers, so far as the rules in question affect relevant undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales.

P2para.Text: A direction under subsection (5) must be given within the period of 28 days beginning with the day after the end of the consultation period,
and rules prepared by the Authority may not be issued before that period of 28 days has expired.
The Minister must issue guidance as to the content of rules under section 143B.
Before issuing the guidance, the Minister must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed guidance;
consult the relevant persons about the draft.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the Welsh Ministers;
such other persons as the Minister thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Minister may from time to time revise the guidance and issue revised guidance.
Subsections (2) and (3) apply to revised guidance as they apply to the original guidance.
The Minister must arrange for the publication of guidance issued under this section.
In this section “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, in relation to relevant undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England;
the Welsh Ministers, in relation to relevant undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales.

P1group.Title: Rules about charges for connections etc

P1para.Text: After section 144 of the Water Industry Act 1991 there is inserted—

P1group.Title: Rules about charges for connections etc

P2para.Text: The Authority may issue rules about charges that may be imposed by a relevant undertaker under—

P3para.Text: section 42(2)(a) (provision of new water main);
section 45(6) (connections with water main);
section 46(7)(b) (ancillary works for domestic connection);
section 99(2)(a) or (2A)(a) (provision of public sewer or lateral drain);
section 101B(3) (lateral drains);
section 107(3)(b)(i) (communications with public sewers);
section 185(5) (moving of pipes etc).

P2para.Text: Rules under this section may in particular—

P3para.Text: make provision about the types of charges that may be imposed;
make provision about the amount or maximum amount, or the methods for determining the amount or maximum amount, of any type of charge;
make provision about the principles for determining what types of charges may or may not be imposed;
make provision about the principles for determining the amount of any change that may be imposed;
provide for charges to be payable over a period.

P2para.Text: The charges that may be imposed by a water undertaker under section 42(2)(a) for the provision of a new water main may include charges for—

P3para.Text: providing such other infrastructure, including other water mains, as it is necessary to provide in consequence of the provision of the new water main;
doing works to increase the capacity of an existing water main, or procuring the doing of such works, where the use of that increased capacity is a consequence of the provision of the new water main.

P2para.Text: The charges that may be imposed by a sewerage undertaker under section 99(2)(a) for the provision of a new public sewer may include charges for—

P3para.Text: providing such other infrastructure, including other public sewers, as it is necessary to provide in consequence of the provision of the new public sewer;
doing works to increase the capacity of an existing public sewer, where the use of that increased capacity is a consequence of the provision of the new public sewer.

P2para.Text: The rules may make provision as to—

P3para.Text: the amount of security that may be required by a relevant undertaker under section 42(1)(b), 47(2)(a), 99(1)(b), 101B(3A), 107(3)(b)(ii) or 185(5);
the type of security that may be required;
the payment of interest on a sum deposited with a relevant undertaker by way of security.

P2para.Text: If the Authority considers that a relevant undertaker is not acting as required by rules under this section, the Authority may give the undertaker a direction to do, or not to do, a thing specified in the direction.
It is the duty of a relevant undertaker to comply with a direction under subsection (6), and this duty is enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
The rules may make—

P3para.Text: different provision for different persons or different descriptions of person;
different provision for different powers to impose charges or different descriptions of such powers.

P2para.Text: The Authority may from time to time review rules issued under this section and issue revised rules.
The Authority must have regard to guidance issued under section 144ZC in making rules under section 144ZA.
Before issuing rules under section 144ZA, the Authority must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed rules, and
consult the relevant persons about the draft.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the Welsh Ministers;
the Council;
any relevant undertakers likely to be affected by the rules;
any water supply or sewerage licensees likely to be affected by the rules;
such other persons as the Authority thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Authority must specify the period (“the consultation period”) within which a person may make representations about the proposed rules.
Before rules under section 144ZA prepared by the Authority are issued, the Minister may direct the Authority—

P3para.Text: not to issue the rules, or
to issue them with specified modifications.

P2para.Text: In subsection (5) “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, so far as the rules in question affect relevant undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England;
the Welsh Ministers, so far as the rules in question affect relevant undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales.

P2para.Text: A direction under subsection (5) must be given within the period of 28 days beginning with the day after the end of the consultation period, and rules prepared by the Authority may not be issued before that period of 28 days has expired.
The Minister must issue guidance as to the content of rules under section 144ZA.
Before issuing the guidance, the Minister must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed guidance;
consult the relevant persons about the draft.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the Welsh Ministers;
such other persons as the Minister thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Minister may from time to time revise the guidance and issue revised guidance.
Subsections (2) and (3) apply to revised guidance as they apply to the original guidance.
The Minister must arrange for the publication of guidance issued under this section.
In this section “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, in relation to relevant undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England;
the Welsh Ministers, in relation to relevant undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales.

P1group.Title: Charges for providing a water main etc

P2para.Text: The Water Industry Act 1991 is amended as follows.
In section 42 (financial conditions for compliance with the duty in section 41 to provide a water main)—

P3para.Text: in subsection (1)(b) (condition as to providing security), for the words from “such security” to “reasonably required” there is substituted “such security as charging rules allow and the undertaker may have required”;
in subsection (2) (undertaking to pay), for paragraph (a) there is substituted—
bind the person or persons mentioned in that subsection to pay to the undertaker such charges as the undertaker may impose in accordance with charging rules, and
subsections (4) and (5) (interest on sums deposited by way of security) are repealed;
in subsection (6) (reference of disputes to Water Services Regulation Authority), in paragraph (b), after “the amount” there is inserted “or amounts by way of charges”.

P2para.Text: In section 45 (duty to make domestic connections to a water main)—

P3para.Text: in subsection (2) (the nature of the duty), the words “, at the expense of the person serving the notice,” are repealed;
for subsection (6) there is substituted—

P2para.Text: Where a water undertaker carries out any works which it is its duty under this section to carry out, the person serving the notice is liable to pay to the undertaker such charges as the undertaker may impose in accordance with charging rules.

P3para.Text: in subsection (6A) (reference of disputes to Authority), for “as to whether the expenses were incurred reasonably” there is substituted “as to the payments required to be made”.

P2para.Text: In section 46 (duty to carry out ancillary works for the purpose of making a domestic connection under section 45)—

P3para.Text: in subsection (1) (the nature of the duty), the words “, at the expense of the person serving the notice,” are repealed;
in subsection (7), in paragraph (b), for “under this section at another person’s expense” there is substituted “as its duty under this section”;
in subsection (7), in the words after paragraph (b), for “under that section at another person’s expense” there is substituted “as its duty under that section”;

in subsection (9) (consequences of exercising power under section 46(8) to lay a water main rather than a service pipe), paragraph (b) (maximum expenses recoverable) and the “but” preceding it are repealed.

P2para.Text: In section 47 (conditions of connection with water main)—

P3para.Text: in subsection (2)(a) (requirement to give security for amounts to be paid), for the words from “such security” to “reasonably require” there is substituted “such security as charging rules allow and the undertaker requires”;
in subsection (3B) (reference of disputes to Authority), in the opening words, “whether” is repealed;
in subsection (3B), for paragraph (a) there is substituted—
the security required to be provided by a condition imposed under subsection (2)(a),
in subsection (3B)(b), at the beginning there is inserted “whether”;
in subsection (3B)(c), after “particular case,” there is inserted “whether”.
