P2para.Text: The Water Industry Act 1991 is amended as follows.
In section 99 (financial conditions for compliance with the duty in section 98 to provide a public sewer or lateral drain)—

P3para.Text: in subsection (1)(b) (condition as to providing security), for the words from “such security” to “reasonably required” there is substituted “such security as charging rules allow and the undertaker may have required”;
in subsection (2) (undertaking to pay in respect of public sewer), for paragraph (a) there is substituted—
bind the person or persons mentioned in that subsection to pay to the undertaker such charges as the undertaker may impose in accordance with charging rules, and
in subsection (2A) (undertaking to pay in respect of lateral drain), for paragraph (a) there is substituted—
bind the person or persons mentioned in that subsection to pay to the undertaker such charges as the undertaker may impose in accordance with charging rules, and
subsections (4) and (5) (interest on sums deposited by way of security) are repealed;
in subsection (6) (reference of disputes to the Water Services Regulation Authority), in paragraph (b), after “the amount” there is inserted “or amounts by way of charges”;

P2para.Text: In section 101B (power to provide lateral drain following provision of public sewer)—

P3para.Text: in subsection (3) (obligation to pay for drain requested), for “the costs reasonably incurred in or in connection with providing that drain” there is substituted “such charges as the undertaker may impose in accordance with charging rules”;
after subsection (3) there is inserted—

P2para.Text: The sewerage undertaker may require the person making a request under this section to provide such security for the payment of the charges as charging rules allow.

P3para.Text: in subsection (4) (reference of disputes to Authority), for paragraph (b) there is substituted—
the amount of any charge imposed,
in subsection (4), after paragraph (b) there is inserted “or
the security required to be provided,

P2para.Text: In section 107 (right of a sewerage undertaker to undertake the making of a communication with a public sewer)—

P3para.Text: in subsection (3)(b)(i) (no obligation for undertaker to act until paid an estimated cost of the work in advance), for “the cost of the work” there is substituted “the amount by way of charges that the undertaker may impose in accordance with charging rules for making the connection”;

in subsection (3)(b)(ii) (no obligation for undertaker to act until given security for payment), for “such security” to the end there is substituted “such security for the payment of that amount as charging rules allow and it may have required.”;
for subsection (4), there is substituted—

P2para.Text: If a payment to a sewerage undertaker under subsection (3) exceeds the charges that may, in the event, be imposed in accordance with charging rules for making the connection in question, the excess is to be repaid by the undertaker; and, if and so far as those charges are not covered by a payment under subsection (3), those charges are to be paid by the person for whom the work was undertaken.

P3para.Text: in subsection (4A) (reference to disputes to Authority), in paragraph (a), for “of the cost of works” there is substituted “of the amount of charges”;
in subsection (4A), for paragraph (b) (and the “or” following it) there is substituted—
the security required by the undertaker, or
in subsection (4A), for paragraph (c) there is substituted—
whether any excess is repayable, or any charges are payable, under subsection (4), or the amount of any such excess or charges,

P2para.Text: In section 146 (connection charges etc, and charges for highway drainage), in subsection (5)(a), after “expenses incurred by it” there is inserted “, or charges imposed by it,”.

P1para.Text: In section 185 of the Water Industry Act 1991 (duty to move pipes etc in certain cases), in subsection (5) (recovery of undertaker’s expenses), for the words from “the undertaker” to the end there is substituted “the person serving the notice is liable to pay to the undertaker such charges as the undertaker may impose in accordance with charging rules”.

P2para.Text: After section 114 of the Water Industry Act 1991 there is inserted—
Sewerage undertakers may construct, on their own or on another’s land, drainage systems for the purpose of reducing the volume of surface water entering public sewers or the rate at which it does so.
A sewerage undertaker may maintain and operate a drainage system constructed by it under subsection (1).
In this section—

Para.Text: “drainage system” means a structure designed to receive rainwater and other surface water, other than a natural watercourse;
“natural watercourse” means a river or stream;
“rainwater” includes snow and other precipitation;
“structure” includes—
any part of an existing or proposed structure, and
any feature or aspect of a design that is intended to receive or facilitate the receipt of rainwater or other surface water.

P2para.Text: The powers conferred by subsections (1) and (2) are not to be regarded as functions of a sewerage undertaker for the purposes of—

P3para.Text: section 155 (compulsory purchase of land required for the purposes of carrying out functions of relevant undertakers);
section 156 (restrictions on disposals of land).

P2para.Text: In section 158 of that Act (powers to lay pipes in streets), in subsection (7) (meaning of reference to a relevant pipe), in paragraph (b)—

P3para.Text: omit the “or” at the end of sub-paragraph (ii);
after sub-paragraph (iii) there is inserted “or

P4para.Text: any pipe forming part of, or required in connection with, a drainage system constructed under section 114A.

P2para.Text: In Schedule 3 to the Flood and Water Management Act 2010 (sustainable drainage), after paragraph 19 there is inserted—

Title.Emphasis: Exception 3: systems under section 114A Water Industry Act 1991

P1para.Text: The adoption duty does not apply to a drainage system constructed under section 114A of the Water Industry Act 1991 (drainage systems relieving public sewers).

Pblock.Title: General duties of the Water Services Regulation Authority

P2para.Text: Section 2 of the Water Industry Act 1991 (general duties with respect to water industry) is amended as follows.
In subsection (2A)—

P3para.Text: omit the “and” at the end of paragraph (c);
after paragraph (d) insert
to further the resilience objective.

P2para.Text: After subsection (2D) insert—
The resilience objective mentioned in subsection (2A)(e) is—

P3para.Text: to secure the long-term resilience of water undertakers’ supply systems and sewerage undertakers’ sewerage systems as against environmental pressures, population growth and changes in consumer behaviour, and
to secure that undertakers take steps for the purpose of enabling them to meet, in the long term, the need for the supply of water and the provision of sewerage services to consumers,

P2para.Text: including by promoting appropriate long-term planning and investment by relevant undertakers, and the taking by them of a range of measures to manage water resources and reduce demand.
For the purposes of subsection (2DA)—

P3para.Text: the reference to water undertakers’ supply systems is to be construed in accordance with section 17B;
the reference to sewerage undertakers’ sewerage systems is a reference to the systems comprising—

P4para.Text: the systems of public sewers, the facilities for emptying public sewers and the sewage disposal works and other facilities for dealing effectually with the contents of public sewers that undertakers are required to provide by section 94, and
the lateral drains that undertakers are required to maintain by section 94.

P1group.Title: General duty as regards undue preference in the provision of services

P1para.Text: In section 2 of the Water Industry Act 1991 (general duties of the Secretary of State and the Water Services Regulation Authority with respect to the water industry), in subsection (3) (general considerations in exercising powers and duties), after paragraph (b) there is inserted—

P3para.Text: to secure that no undue preference (including for itself) is shown, and that there is no undue discrimination, in the doing by such a company of—

P4para.Text: such things as relate to the provision of services by itself or another such company, or
such things as relate to the provision of services by a water supply licensee or a sewerage licensee;

P2para.Text: For section 2A of the Water Industry Act 1991 there is substituted—

The Secretary of State may from time to time publish a statement setting out strategic priorities and objectives for the Authority in carrying out relevant functions relating wholly or mainly to England.
The Authority must carry out those functions in accordance with any statement published under this section.
In formulating a statement under this section, the Secretary of State—

P3para.Text: must have regard to the duties imposed on the Authority under section 2, and
may have regard to social and environmental matters, amongst other things.

P2para.Text: Before publishing a statement under this section, the Secretary of State must consult—

P3para.Text: the Authority,
the Council,
relevant undertakers,
licensed water suppliers,
the Environment Agency,
the Welsh Ministers, and
anyone else the Secretary of State thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: Before publishing a statement under this section the Secretary of State must—

P3para.Text: lay a draft of the statement before Parliament, and
then wait until the end of the 40-day period.

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may not publish the statement under this section if, within the 40-day period, either House of Parliament resolves not to approve it.

“The 40-day period” means the period of 40 days beginning with the day on which the draft is laid before Parliament (or, if it is not laid before each House on the same day, the later of the days on which it is laid).
When calculating the 40-day period, ignore any period during which Parliament is dissolved or prorogued or during which both Houses are adjourned for more than 4 days.
In this section “relevant functions relating wholly or mainly to England” means the functions mentioned in section 2(1)(b) so far as they relate to appointment areas wholly or mainly in England.
In subsection (9) “appointment area” means an area for which an appointment is held under Chapter 1 of Part 2.
The Welsh Ministers may from time to time publish a statement setting out strategic priorities and objectives for the Authority in carrying out relevant functions relating wholly or mainly to Wales.
The Authority must carry out those functions in accordance with any statement published under this section.
In formulating a statement under this section the Welsh Ministers—

P3para.Text: must have regard to the duties imposed on the Authority under section 2, and
may have regard to social and environmental matters, amongst other things.

P2para.Text: Before publishing a statement under this section, the Welsh Ministers must consult—

P3para.Text: the Authority,
the Council,
relevant undertakers,
licensed water suppliers,
the NRBW,
the Secretary of State, and
anyone else the Welsh Ministers think appropriate.

P2para.Text: Before publishing a statement under this section the Welsh Ministers must—

P3para.Text: lay a draft of the statement before the Assembly, and
then wait until the end of the 40-day period.

P2para.Text: The Welsh Ministers may not publish the statement under this section if, within the 40-day period, the Assembly resolves not to approve it.
“The 40-day period” means the period of 40 days beginning with the day on which the draft is laid before the Assembly.
When calculating the 40-day period, ignore any period during which the Assembly is dissolved or is in recess for more than 4 days.
In this section “relevant functions relating wholly or mainly to Wales” means the functions mentioned in section 2(1)(b) so far as they relate to appointment areas wholly or mainly in Wales.
In subsection (9) “appointment area” means an area for which an appointment is held under Chapter 1 of Part 2.
In section 2(6A), (6B) and (7) of that Act (general duties with respect to water industry), for “section 2A” there is substituted “sections 2A and 2B”.
In section 192A of that Act (forward work programme), after subsection (3) there is inserted—
The forward work programme for any year must also include an explanation of how the projects described in it reflect any strategic priorities or objectives published under section 2A or 2B.

Pblock.Title: Regulation of relevant undertakers, water supply licensees and sewerage licensees

P1group.Title: Procedure for granting water supply and sewerage licences

P2para.Text: Section 17F of the Water Industry Act 1991 (procedure for granting water supply licences) is amended as follows.
For subsection (1) (application to be made as set out in regulations) there is substituted—
The Authority must determine for each type of relevant application that may be made—

P3para.Text: the form and manner in which an application is to be made;
the information it is to contain;
the documents that are to accompany it;
the fee that is to accompany it.

P2para.Text: The fees may be different in different circumstances.
The Authority may make a new determination as to a matter referred to in subsection (1).

The Authority must publish a notice of what it has determined under subsection (1) or (1B) in such manner as it thinks appropriate for bringing the determination to the attention of those affected by the determination.
For the purposes of subsection (1) a relevant application is an application for—

P3para.Text: the grant of a water supply or sewerage licence giving a particular authorisation or combination of authorisations;
the variation of a water supply or sewerage licence so that it gives—

P4para.Text: a particular authorisation only, or
a particular combination of authorisations.

P2para.Text: A person making a relevant application must comply with such provisions of a notice published under subsection (1C) as relate to the application.
Subsections (2), (3) and (5) (requirement for applicant to publish notice of an application made) are repealed.

In subsection (4) (procedure where the Secretary of State or the Authority proposes to refuse an application), for “the application”, in the first place it occurs, there is substituted “a relevant application”.

P1group.Title: Extension of time limit for imposing financial penalties

P2para.Text: In section 22C of the Water Industry Act 1991 (time limits on the imposition of financial penalties), in subsection (1), for “twelve months” there is substituted “five years”.
But subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a contravention or failure which—

P3para.Text: occurred before the date on which this section comes into force, and
is not continuing on that date.

P1group.Title: Water resources management plans for England: resilience

P2para.Text: Chapter 1 of Part 3 of the Water Industry Act 1991 (water supply) is amended as follows.
In section 37A(3) (water resources management plans: preparation and review), at the end insert—
(and see also section 37AA).
After that section insert—

P1group.Title: Water resources management plans for England: resilience

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may give a direction about the basis on which a water resources management plan for England is to be prepared.

A direction under this section may be given only where the Secretary of State considers it appropriate to do so with a view to securing that a water undertaker is able to meet the need for the supply of water to consumers in particular circumstances.
A direction under this section may, in particular, require a plan to be prepared on the basis of a specified assumption, including—

P3para.Text: an assumption as to whether, and how often, specified circumstances are likely to arise;
an assumption that a specified power would or would not be exercised by the water undertaker or another person in specified circumstances.

P2para.Text: Before giving a direction under this section, the Secretary of State must consult—

P3para.Text: the Authority,
the Welsh Ministers,
each water undertaker to whom the direction would apply,
the Environment Agency, and
such other persons as the Secretary of State considers appropriate.

P2para.Text: In this section—

Para.Text: “specified” means specified in a direction under this section;
“water resources management plan for England” means a water resources management plan prepared by a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England.

P2para.Text: In section 37D(1) (water resources management plans: directions), after “37A” insert “, 37AA”.

P1group.Title: Frequency of water resources management and drought plans

P2para.Text: The Water Industry Act 1991 is amended as follows.
In section 37A (water resources management plans: preparation and review)—

P3para.Text: in subsection (1), after “prepare” there is inserted “, publish”;
in subsection (4), after “preparing” there is inserted “and publishing”;
in subsection (6), in the opening words, after “prepare” there is inserted “and publish”.

P2para.Text: In section 37D (water resources management plans: supplementary), after subsection (3) there is inserted—
The Minister may by order made by statutory instrument change the period for the time being specified in section 37A(6)(c).
In subsection (4), “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, in relation to an order applying to water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England, and
the Welsh Ministers, in relation to an order applying to water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales.

P2para.Text: A statutory instrument containing an order made by the Secretary of State under subsection (4) is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament.
A statutory instrument containing an order made by the Welsh Ministers under subsection (4) is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of the Assembly.
Subsection (9) applies in relation to a statutory instrument containing both—

P3para.Text: an order made by the Secretary of State under subsection (4), and
an order made by the Welsh Ministers under subsection (4).

P2para.Text: If in accordance with subsection (6) or (7) (negative resolution procedure)—

P3para.Text: either House of Parliament resolves that an address be presented to Her Majesty praying that an instrument containing an order made by the Secretary of State be annulled, or
the Assembly resolves that an instrument containing an order made by the Welsh Ministers be annulled,

P2para.Text: the instrument is to have no further effect and Her Majesty may by Order in Council revoke the instrument.
In section 39B (drought plans: preparation and review)—

P3para.Text: in subsection (1), after “prepare” there is inserted “, publish”;
in subsection (6)—

P4para.Text: in the opening words, after “prepare” there is inserted “and publish”;
in paragraph (c) (long-stop date) for “three years” there is substituted “five years”.

P2para.Text: After section 39C (drought plans: provision of information) there is inserted—
The Minister may by order made by statutory instrument amend the period for the time being specified in section 39B(6)(c).
In subsection (1), “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, in relation to an order applying to water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England, and
the Welsh Ministers, in relation to an order applying to water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales.

P2para.Text: A statutory instrument containing an order made by the Secretary of State under subsection (1) is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament.
A statutory instrument containing an order made by the Welsh Ministers under subsection (1) is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of the Assembly.
Subsection (6) applies in relation to a statutory instrument containing both—

P3para.Text: an order made by the Secretary of State under subsection (1), and
an order made by the Welsh Ministers under subsection (1).

P2para.Text: If in accordance with subsection (3) or (4) (negative resolution procedure)—

P3para.Text: either House of Parliament resolves that an address be presented to Her Majesty praying that an instrument containing an order made by the Secretary of State be annulled, or
the Assembly resolves that an instrument containing an order made by the Welsh Ministers be annulled,

P2para.Text: the instrument is to have no further effect and Her Majesty may by Order in Council revoke the instrument.
After section 38 of the Water Industry Act 1991 there is inserted—

P1group.Title: Standards of performance in connection with the supply of water: water supply licensees

P2para.Text: For the purpose of establishing overall standards of performance in connection with the supply of water by water supply licensees in accordance with their retail authorisations, the Secretary of State may, in accordance with section 39ZA, by regulations—

P3para.Text: impose requirements in connection with such supplies of water;
provide for a requirement so imposed to be enforceable under section 18 by—

P4para.Text: the Secretary of State, or
the Authority, with the consent of or in accordance with a general authorisation given by the Secretary of State.

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may, in accordance with section 39ZA, by regulations prescribe such standards of performance in connection with the provision of supplies of water as, in the Secretary of State’s opinion, ought to be achieved in individual cases.
Regulations under subsection (2) may provide that if a water supply licensee fails to meet a prescribed standard the licensee must pay such amount as may be prescribed to any person who—

P3para.Text: is affected by the failure, and
is of a prescribed description.

P2para.Text: Without prejudice to the generality of the power conferred by subsection (2), regulations under subsection (2) may—

P3para.Text: include in a standard of performance a requirement for a water supply licensee, in prescribed circumstances, to inform a person of that person’s rights by virtue of any such regulations;
provide for a dispute under the regulations to be referred by either party to the dispute to the Authority;
make provision for the procedure to be followed in connection with any such reference and for the Authority’s determination on such a reference to be enforceable in such manner as may be prescribed;
prescribe circumstances in which a water supply licensee is to be exempted from requirements of the regulations.

P2para.Text: Where the Authority determines any dispute in accordance with regulations under this section it must, in such manner as may be specified in the regulations, give its reasons for reaching its decision with respect to the dispute.
Section 38A of that Act (information as to levels of performance of water undertakers) is amended in accordance with subsections (3) to (6).
In subsection (1) (duty of Water Services Regulation Authority to collect information)—

P3para.Text: the “and” following paragraph (a) is repealed;
after paragraph (a) there is inserted—
the compensation paid by water supply licensees under regulations under section 38ZA(2); and
in paragraph (b), after “water undertakers” there is inserted “or water supply licensees”.

P2para.Text: After subsection (2) there is inserted—
At such times as the Authority may direct, each water supply licensee is to give the following information to the Authority—

P3para.Text: as respects each standard established by regulations under section 38ZA(1), such information with respect to the level of performance achieved by the licensee as may be prescribed;
as respects each standard prescribed by regulations under section 38ZA(2), the number of cases in which compensation was paid and the aggregate amount or value of that compensation.

P2para.Text: For subsection (3) (offence of failing to comply with subsection (2)) there is substituted—
The requirements in subsections (2) and (2A) are enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
In subsection (4) (publication of information collected), after “water undertakers” there is inserted “or water supply licensees”.
After section 39 there is inserted—
Section 39 applies for the purposes of making regulations under section 38ZA as it applies for the purposes of making regulations under section 38.
In the application of section 39 by virtue of subsection (1), a reference to a water undertaker is to be treated as a reference to a water supply licensee.
After section 95 of the Water Industry Act 1991 there is inserted—

P1group.Title: Standards of performance in connection with the provision of sewerage services: sewerage licensees

P2para.Text: For the purpose of establishing overall standards of performance in connection with the provision of sewerage services by sewerage licensees in accordance with their retail authorisations, the Secretary of State may, in accordance with section 96ZA, by regulations—

P3para.Text: impose requirements in connection with the provision of sewerage services;
provide for a requirement so imposed to be enforceable under section 18 by—

P4para.Text: the Secretary of State, or
the Authority, with the consent of or in accordance with a general authorisation given by the Secretary of State.

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may, in accordance with section 96ZA, by regulations prescribe such standards of performance in connection with the provision of sewerage services as, in the Secretary of State’s opinion, ought to be achieved in individual cases.
Regulations under subsection (2) may provide that if a sewerage licensee fails to meet a prescribed standard the licensee must pay such amount as may be prescribed to any person who—

P3para.Text: is affected by the failure, and
is of a prescribed description.

P2para.Text: Without prejudice to the generality of the power conferred by subsection (2), regulations under subsection (2) may—

P3para.Text: include in a standard of performance a requirement for a sewerage licensee, in prescribed circumstances, to inform a person of that person’s rights by virtue of any such regulations;
provide for a dispute under the regulations to be referred by either party to the dispute to the Authority;
make provision for the procedure to be followed in connection with any such reference and for the Authority’s determination on such a reference to be enforceable in such manner as may be prescribed;
prescribe circumstances in which a sewerage licensee is to be exempted from requirements of the regulations.

P2para.Text: Where the Authority determines any dispute in accordance with regulations under this section it must, in such manner as may be specified in the regulations, give its reasons for reaching its decision with respect to the dispute.
Section 95A of that Act (information as to levels of performance of sewerage undertakers) is amended in accordance with subsections (3) to (6).
In subsection (1) (duty of Water Services Regulation Authority to collect information)—

P3para.Text: the “and” following paragraph (a) is repealed;
after paragraph (a) there is inserted—
the compensation paid by sewerage licensees under regulations under section 95ZA(2); and
in paragraph (b), after “sewerage undertakers” there is inserted “or sewerage licensees”.

P2para.Text: After subsection (2) there is inserted—
At such times as the Authority may direct, each sewerage licensee is to give the following information to the Authority—

P3para.Text: as respects each standard established by regulations under section 95ZA(1), such information with respect to the level of performance achieved by the licensee as may be prescribed;
as respects each standard prescribed by regulations under section 95ZA(2), the number of cases in which compensation was paid and the aggregate amount or value of that compensation.

P2para.Text: For subsection (3) (offence of failing to comply with subsection (2)) there is substituted—
The requirements in subsections (2) and (2A) are enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
In subsection (4) (publication of information collected), after “sewerage undertakers” there is inserted “or sewerage licensees”.
After section 96 there is inserted—
Section 96 applies for the purposes of making regulations under section 95ZA) as it applies for the purposes of making regulations under section 95.
In the application of section 96 by virtue of subsection (1), a reference to a sewerage undertaker is to be treated as a reference to a sewerage licensee.
The Water Industry Act 1991 is amended as follows.
In section 142 (powers of undertakers to charge), after subsection (6) there is
inserted—
If an undertaker makes an agreement that falls within subsection (2)(b), it must notify the Authority of the provisions of the agreement.
The requirement in subsection (6A) is enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
In section 195 (the Water Services Regulation Authority’s register relating to relevant undertakers and licensees)—

P3para.Text: in subsection (3) (power to direct that provisions of an undertaker’s appointment etc are not entered in the register), after “any provision” there is inserted “or, in the case of information that falls to be entered under subsection (3B), any information”;
in subsection (3), after “that provision” there is inserted “or that information”;
after subsection (3A) there is inserted—

P2para.Text: Subject to any direction given under subsection (3), the Authority must cause to be entered on the register such information about an agreement falling within section 142(2)(b) as the Authority thinks fit.
Subsection (3B) has effect in relation to agreements made after the coming into force of section 31 of the Water Act 2013.

P1group.Title: Register relating to undertakers and licensees

P2para.Text: Section 195 of the Water Industry Act 1991 (the Water Services Regulation Authority’s register relating to undertakers and licensees) is amended as follows.
In subsection (1) (register to be maintained in a certain place, in a certain form and for certain purposes), the words from “for the purposes” to the end are repealed.
After subsection (3C) (inserted by section 31) there is inserted—
Subject to any direction given under subsection (3), the Authority must cause to be entered on the register the provisions of—

P3para.Text: a notice under section 40F(3) (reduction in charges payable under a bulk supply agreement);
a notice under section 66EA(3) (reduction in charges payable under a section 66D agreement);
a notice under section 110G(3) (reduction in charges payable under a main connection agreement);
a notice under section 117J(3) (reduction in charges payable under a section 117E agreement).

P1para.Text: In section 195 of the Water Industry Act 1991, for subsections (4) to (6) (inspection of the register and fees for certified copies or extracts) there is substituted—

P2para.Text: The Authority must publish a notice setting out—

P3para.Text: the times at which the contents of the register are for the time being available for inspection by the public;
the fees that must be paid for, or in connection with, an inspection of the contents of the register;
the fees that must be paid for, or in connection with, the supply by the Authority of—

P4para.Text: a copy of the contents of the register, certified by the Authority as being a true copy, or
an extract from the contents of the register, certified by the Authority as being a true extract.

P2para.Text: The Authority must publish the notice in such manner as the Authority thinks appropriate for bringing it to the attention of the persons who, in the Authority’s opinion, are likely to be affected by it.
The Authority must make the contents of the register available for inspection by the public—

P3para.Text: during such hours, and
on payment of such fees,

P2para.Text: as are set out in the notice under subsection (4) that is for the time being in force.
Section 203 of the Water Industry Act 1991 (power to acquire information for enforcement purposes) is amended as follows.
For subsection (1) there is substituted—
The Minister or the Authority may serve a notice under subsection (2) in respect of—

P3para.Text: a company that holds an appointment as a relevant undertaker, if of the opinion that Condition 1 is satisfied, or
a person who holds a licence under Chapter 1A of Part 2, if of the opinion that Condition 2 is satisfied.

P2para.Text: Condition 1 is that the company—

P3para.Text: may be contravening, or may have contravened, a condition of the appointment or a statutory or other requirement enforceable under section 18,

may be causing or contributing to, or may have caused or contributed to, a contravention by another company holding an appointment as a relevant undertaker of a condition of the appointment or a statutory or other requirement enforceable under section 18,

may be causing or contributing to, or may have caused or contributed to, a contravention by a person holding a licence under Chapter 1A of Part 2 of a condition of the licence or a statutory or other requirement enforceable under section 18,
has not met the standards prescribed under section 38(2) in connection with the provision of supplies of water, or
has not met the standards prescribed under section 95(2) in connection with the provision of sewerage services.

P2para.Text: Condition 2 is that the person—

P3para.Text: may be contravening, or may have contravened, a condition of the licence or a statutory or other requirement enforceable under section 18,

may be causing or contributing to, or may have caused or contributed to, a contravention by a company holding an appointment as a relevant undertaker of a condition of the appointment or a statutory or other requirement enforceable under section 18,

may be causing or contributing to, or may have caused or contributed to, a contravention by another person holding a licence under Chapter 1A of Part 2 of a condition of the licence or a statutory or other requirement enforceable under section 18,
has not met the standards prescribed under section 38ZA(2) in connection with the provision of water supplies, or
has not met the standards prescribed under section 95ZA(2) in connection with the provision of sewerage services.

P2para.Text: The notice may be served—

P3para.Text: on any person;
for any purpose connected with powers under Chapter 2 of Part 2.

P2para.Text: In subsections (2) and (6), for “Secretary of State”, in each place where those words occur, there is substituted “Minister”.
In subsection (7)—

P3para.Text: for “or licence” there is substituted “or a person holding such a licence”;
the words “to him” are repealed;
the words “him with” are repealed.

P2para.Text: After subsection (7) there is inserted—
The Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State in respect of—

P4para.Text: any relevant undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England;
any water supply licensee or sewerage licensee carrying out licensed activities using the supply system or sewerage system of any such undertaker;

P3para.Text: the Welsh Ministers in respect of—

P4para.Text: any relevant undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales;
any water supply licensee or sewerage licensee carrying out licensed activities using the supply system or sewerage system of any such undertaker.

P2para.Text: In this section—

P3para.Text: references to the supply system of a water undertaker are to be construed in accordance with section 17B;
references to the sewerage system of a sewerage undertaker are to be construed in accordance with section 17BA(7).

P1group.Title: Appeals relating to revisions of codes

P2para.Text: The Water Industry Act 1991 is amended as follows.
After section 207 there is inserted—

Pblock.Title: Appeals relating to revisions of codes

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may by regulations provide for an appeal to lie to the CMA from—

P3para.Text: a decision by the Authority to make a revision to a designated code;
a decision by the Authority, following consultation under this Act about a proposed revision to a designated code, not to make the proposed revision.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this section a designated code is a code, or a part of a code, issued by the Authority under or by virtue of this Act that is designated for the purposes of this section by regulations under this section.
The regulations may specify descriptions of revisions by reference to which an appeal under the regulations may not be brought.
Regulations made under subsection (3) may provide—

P3para.Text: for the exclusion of certain descriptions of revisions to operate only in such cases as may be determined in accordance with the regulations;
for a determination in accordance with the regulations to be made—

P4para.Text: by such persons,
in accordance with such procedures, and
by reference to such matters and the opinions of such persons (including the Authority),

P3para.Text: as may be provided for in the regulations.

P2para.Text: The regulations may—

P3para.Text: specify the persons or descriptions of persons eligible to bring an appeal;
specify conditions to be satisfied by a person wishing to bring an appeal.

P2para.Text: Regulations made under subsection (5) may—

P3para.Text: make different provision in relation to different codes or different parts of a code;
provide for a representative body or association to bring an appeal.

P2para.Text: The regulations must—

P3para.Text: provide for appeals to be brought only where the CMA grants permission for an appeal;
provide for the grounds on which the CMA may refuse permission.

P2para.Text: Before making regulations under this section the Secretary of State must consult—

P3para.Text: the Welsh Ministers;
the Authority;
such other persons as the Secretary of State considers appropriate.

P2para.Text: The functions of the CMA with respect to appeals under section 207A are not to be regarded as comprised in its general functions for the purposes of Part 2 of Schedule 7 to the Competition Act 1998 (manner in which general functions are to be carried out).
Schedule 16 (provision as to procedure on appeals) has effect.
The Secretary of State may by regulations provide for the determination by the CMA of an appeal under section 207A.

The regulations must require the CMA in determining the appeal to have regard, to the same extent as is required of the Authority, to the matters to which the Authority must have regard in exercising or performing the powers and duties mentioned in section 2(1).
The regulations must provide that the CMA in determining the appeal—

P3para.Text: may have regard to any matter to which the Authority was not able to have regard in the case of the decision appealed against, but
must not, in the exercise of that power, have regard to any matter to which the Authority would not have been entitled to have regard in that case had it had the opportunity of doing so.

P2para.Text: The regulations may specify the grounds on which an appeal may be allowed.
The grounds specified by the regulations may include the following—

P3para.Text: that the Authority failed properly to have regard to the matters mentioned in subsection (2);
that the Authority failed properly to have regard to the purposes for which the code in question is issued;
that the Authority failed to give the appropriate weight to one or more of those matters or purposes.

P2para.Text: The regulations may make provision for the steps that the CMA is to take—

P3para.Text: if it allows the appeal;
if it does not allow the appeal.

P2para.Text: Provision under subsection (6)(a) may include remitting a matter to the Authority for reconsideration and redetermination in accordance with directions given by the CMA.
The regulations may make provision as to the decision of the CMA on the appeal, including in particular provision for the decision—

P3para.Text: to be contained in an order made by the CMA;
to set out the reasons for the decision;
to take effect—

P4para.Text: at the time specified in the order, or
at the time determined in accordance with provision set out in the order;

P3para.Text: to be notified to the persons who were parties to the appeal (see paragraph 2 of Schedule 16); and
to be published.

P2para.Text: Provision under subsection (8)(e) may allow the CMA to exclude from publication any information which it is satisfied is—

P3para.Text: commercial information the disclosure of which would, or might, significantly harm the legitimate business interests of an undertaking to which it relates;
information relating to the private affairs of an individual the disclosure of which would, or might, in its opinion, significantly harm his interests.

P1group.Title: Functions carried out by a CMA group

P1para.Text: Except where otherwise provided, the functions of the CMA with respect to appeals under section 207A are to be carried out on behalf of the CMA by a group constituted for the purpose by the chair of the CMA under Schedule 4 to the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Act 2013.

P2para.Text: After Schedule 15 there is inserted the Schedule set out in Schedule 6 to this Act.

Pblock.Title: Guidance relating to rules about charges

P1group.Title: Guidance relating to rules about charges

P1para.Text: In the Water Industry Act 1991, after section 144ZC there is inserted—

P1group.Title: Guidance relating to rules about charges

P2para.Text: The Minister may issue guidance about the provisions of—

P3para.Text: rules under section 40E;
rules under section 51CD;
rules under section 66E;
rules issued in accordance with regulations under section 66M;
rules under section 105ZF;
rules under section 110F;
rules under section 117I;
rules under section 143B;
rules under section 144ZA.

P2para.Text: The guidance may in particular make provision about the principles to be applied by the Authority in determining the provisions of the rules.
The Authority must have regard to guidance issued under this section (as well as to any guidance issued in respect of rules made under a particular provision).
Before issuing the guidance, the Minister must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed guidance;
consult the relevant persons about the draft;
comply with the requirements of section 144ZE.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the Welsh Ministers;
the Council;
any relevant undertakers likely to be affected by the proposed guidance;
any water supply licensees or sewerage licensees likely to be affected by the proposed guidance;
such other persons as the Minister thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Minister may from time to time revise the guidance and issue revised guidance.
Subsections (4) and (5) apply to revised guidance as they apply to the original guidance.
The Minister must arrange for the publication of guidance issued under this section.
In this section “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, in relation to relevant undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England;
the Welsh Ministers, in relation to relevant undertakers whose area are wholly or mainly in Wales.

P2para.Text: Before issuing guidance under section 144ZD, the Secretary of State must lay a draft of the proposed guidance before both Houses of Parliament.
The Secretary of State must not issue the guidance until after the period of 40 days beginning with—

P3para.Text: the day on which the draft is laid before both Houses of Parliament, or
if the draft is laid before the House of Lords on one day and the House of Commons on another, the later of those two days.

P2para.Text: If before the end of that period either House resolves that the guidance should not be issued, the Secretary of State may not issue it.
In reckoning any period of 40 days for the purposes of subsection (2), no account is to be taken of any time during which—

P3para.Text: Parliament is dissolved or prorogued, or
both Houses are adjourned for more than four days.

P2para.Text: Before issuing guidance under section 144ZE, the Welsh Ministers must lay a draft of the proposed guidance before the Assembly.
The Welsh Ministers must not issue the guidance until after the period of 40 days beginning with the day on which the draft is laid before the Assembly.
If before the end of that period the Assembly resolves that the guidance should not be issued, the Welsh Ministers may not issue it.
In reckoning any period of 40 days for the purposes of subsection (6), no account is to be taken of any time during which the Assembly is dissolved or is in recess for more than four days.
Nothing in this section prevents the Secretary of State and the Welsh Ministers issuing a single document containing guidance under section 144ZE, and preparing draft guidance accordingly.

P1group.Title: Exercise of adjudication functions by other persons

P1para.Text: After section 207D of the Water Industry Act 1991 (inserted by section 35) there is inserted—

P1group.Title: Exercise of adjudication functions by other persons

P2para.Text: The Minister may by order made by statutory instrument provide that any of the Authority’s adjudication functions (see subsection (4)) is to be exercised—

P3para.Text: on the Authority’s behalf, by such person as may be specified in the order, or
either by the Authority or, on the Authority’s behalf, by such person as may be specified in the order, at the option of the Authority in any particular case.

P2para.Text: An order under subsection (1) may—

P3para.Text: provide for requirements applying to the exercise of a function by the Authority to apply to the exercise of the function by another person;
require the Authority to produce guidance as to the exercise by another person of one of the Authority’s adjudication functions and to keep such guidance up to date;
require a person exercising one of the Authority’s adjudication functions to have regard to—

P4para.Text: any guidance to which the Authority would have regard in exercising that function;
any guidance produced by the Authority as to the exercise of that function.

P2para.Text: An order under subsection (1) may—

P3para.Text: make different provision for different purposes;
apply any primary or secondary legislation with or without modifications;
make supplemental, consequential and transitional provision.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this section, the Authority’s adjudication functions are—

P3para.Text: the determination of any matter referred to it for determination under section 30A;
the Authority’s functions under any of the following—

Para.Text: regulations made by virtue of section 38(4) (power to prescribe by regulations standards of performance for water undertakers as regards water supply in individual cases: provision for disputes etc);

regulations made by virtue of section 38ZA(4) (power to prescribe by regulations standards of performance for water supply licensees as regards water supply in individual cases: provision for disputes etc);

regulations made by virtue of section 95(4) (power to prescribe by regulations standards of performance for sewerage undertakers as regards sewerage services in individual cases: provision for disputes etc);

regulations made by virtue of section 95ZA(4) (power to prescribe by regulations standards of performance for sewerage licensees as regards sewerage services in individual cases: provision for disputes etc);

P1group.Title: Modification of appointment and licence conditions

P2para.Text: The Water Services Regulation Authority may modify the conditions of appointment of a company appointed under Chapter 1 of Part 2 of the Water Industry Act 1991 to be a water or sewerage undertaker where it considers it necessary or expedient to do so in consequence of provision made by or under this Part.

The Authority may modify the conditions of a licence under Chapter 1A of Part 2 of the Water Industry Act 1991 where it considers it necessary or expedient to do so in consequence of provision made by or under this Part.
Where the Authority modifies—

P3para.Text: conditions of appointment under subsection (1), or
conditions of a licence under subsection (2),

P2para.Text: it may make such incidental or consequential modifications of other conditions of the appointment or, as the case may be, other conditions of the licence as it considers necessary or expedient.

the Welsh Ministers;
such other persons as the Authority thinks it appropriate to consult.

the conditions of a person’s licence under subsection (2),

P2para.Text: may not be exercised after the end of the period of two years beginning with the day on which the provision in question comes into force.

The Minister may give directions to the Authority for the purpose of securing that—

P3para.Text: the conditions of appointment of a water or sewerage undertaker are modified under this section;
the conditions of a licence under Chapter 1A of Part 2 of the Water Industry Act 1991 are modified under this section.

P1group.Title: Main rivers in England and Wales

P2para.Text: The Water Resources Act 1991 is amended as follows.
For sections 193 and 194 (maintenance, inspection and amendment of main river maps for areas in England and Wales) there is substituted—

P1group.Title: The main river map for England

P2para.Text: The Agency must keep the main river map for England.
For the purposes of this Act the main river map for England is a record of areas in England which—

P3para.Text: shows the extent to which any watercourse or part of a watercourse is to be treated as a main river or as part of a main river for the purposes of this Act, and
indicates which (if any) of those watercourses are watercourses designated in a scheme made under section 137.

P2para.Text: The map is conclusive as to the extent to which a watercourse in England is to be treated as a main river or as part of a main river for the purposes of this Act.
The map must specify the date on which it takes effect.
The Agency must keep the map in electronic form.
In this section and sections 193A to 193E “watercourse” has the same meaning as in Part 4 of this Act.
The Agency must provide reasonable facilities for inspecting the main river map for England in electronic form.
The Agency must on request provide any person with—

P3para.Text: a hard copy of all or part of the map, or
data comprising all or part of the map in electronic form.

P2para.Text: The Agency may charge a fee for providing a copy or data under subsection (2), but the fee—

P3para.Text: must, in the case of a person appearing to the Agency to have requested a copy or data for commercial purposes, represent a reasonable usage fee, and
in any other case, may not exceed the reasonable costs of providing the copy or data.

P2para.Text: The Agency must on request provide a body mentioned in the first column of the following table with a hard copy of, or data comprising, such part of the main river map for England as is described in the second column of the entry for that body.

tr.td: A local authority in England
The part that relates to the local authority’s area
An internal drainage board for an internal drainage district that is wholly or partly in England
The part that relates to its district, so far as that district is in England
A water company that exercises functions in relation to an area in England
The part that relates to that area
A highway authority that exercises functions in relation to highways in England
The part that relates to the area in England in relation to which it exercises functions
A navigation authority that exercises functions in relation to an area in England
The part that relates to that area

P2para.Text: The Documentary Evidence Act 1868 has effect as if—

P3para.Text: the Agency were mentioned in the first column of the Schedule to that Act;
any member of the staff of the Agency authorised to act on behalf of the Agency were specified in the second column of the Schedule to that Act in connection with the Agency;
the regulation referred to in that Act included the main river map for England kept by the Agency;
references to a copy included references to a print-out of information kept in electronic form.

P1group.Title: Replacing the main river map for England

P2para.Text: The Agency may at any time replace the existing main river map for England for the purpose of including—

P3para.Text: a change which, pursuant to section 193(2)(b), is required by the making, amendment or revocation of a scheme under section 137,
a change to give effect to a determination under section 193C, or
a change directed by the Secretary of State under section 193D(5) (following an appeal against a determination).

P2para.Text: A replacement map may not include other changes.
A replacement map must specify the date on which it takes effect.
Subject to the following provisions of this section, the Agency may determine that—

P3para.Text: such watercourse or part of a watercourse in England as is specified in the determination is to be treated for the purposes of this Act as a main river or part of a main river;

such watercourse or part of a watercourse in England as is specified in the determination (not being a watercourse designated in a scheme made under section 137) is no longer to be treated for the purposes of this Act as a main river or part of a main river.

P2para.Text: Before making a determination under subsection (1) as regards a watercourse, the Agency must—

P3para.Text: publish (in such manner as it considers appropriate) the determination it proposes to make, and
consider representations made within the time and in the manner specified by the Agency when publishing the determination.

P2para.Text: The Agency must consult the NRBW before making a determination under subsection (1)—

P3para.Text: which affects a watercourse part of which is in England and part of which is in Wales, and
in which it seems to the Agency that the NRBW has an interest.

P2para.Text: Having taken such steps as are required by subsections (2) and (3), the Agency may—

P3para.Text: decide not to make a determination, or
decide to make a determination in accordance with what was proposed under subsection (2)(a) or otherwise.

P2para.Text: The Agency must publish (in such manner as it considers appropriate)—

P3para.Text: that decision;
the terms of any determination made;
if a determination is made, the date on which a replacement map will give effect to the determination.

P2para.Text: The date specified under subsection (5)(c) may not be before the end of a period of six weeks beginning with the day on which the matters specified in subsection (5) are published.

The Agency must also inform those persons affected by the proposal who made representations in accordance with subsection (2)(b) containing an objection to the proposal as to the matters referred to in subsection (5).
A person aggrieved by a determination under section 193C may appeal to the Secretary of State.
An appeal must be made before the end of a period of six weeks beginning with the day on which the matters referred to in section 193C(5) are published.
Where an appeal is made against a determination, a replacement map under section 193B may not include a change to give effect to the determination except as specified in this section.
The Secretary of State may appoint a person to make a report to assist the Secretary of State in determining the appeal.
If the Secretary of State allows the appeal in whole or in part, the Secretary of State may by direction to the Agency—

P3para.Text: specify a change to be included in a replacement map under section 193B, and
specify the date on which that change is to take effect.

P2para.Text: If the Secretary of State dismisses the appeal, the Agency may include a change to give effect to its determination in a replacement map, the replacement map to have effect on such date as the Secretary of State may direct.
The Secretary of State may direct the Agency to publish the Secretary of State’s decision in such manner as the direction may specify.
The Secretary of State may from time to time issue guidance to the Agency about the exercise of its functions under sections 193 to 193D.
The guidance may in particular include guidance as to—

P3para.Text: determining whether or not a watercourse or part of a watercourse is suitable to become or to remain a main river or a part of a main river;
what kind of publication is appropriate under section 193C(2) and (5).

P2para.Text: The Agency must have regard to the guidance in carrying out its functions under sections 193 to 193D.

P1group.Title: The main river map for Wales

For the purposes of this Act the main river map for Wales is a record of areas in Wales which—

P3para.Text: shows the extent to which any watercourse or part of a watercourse is to be treated as a main river or as part of a main river for the purposes of this Act, and

The map must specify the date on which it takes effect.
The NRBW must keep the map in electronic form.

The NRBW must provide reasonable facilities for inspecting the main river map for Wales in electronic form.
The NRBW must on request provide any person with—

P3para.Text: a hard copy of all or part of the map, or
data comprising all or part of the map in electronic form.

P2para.Text: The NRBW may charge a fee for providing a copy or data under subsection (2), but the fee—

P3para.Text: must, in the case of a person appearing to the NRBW to have requested a copy or data for commercial purposes, represent a reasonable usage fee, and
in any other case, may not exceed the reasonable costs of providing the copy or data.

P2para.Text: The NRBW must on request provide a body mentioned in the first column of the following table with a hard copy of, or data comprising, such part of the main river map for Wales as is described in the second column of the entry for that body.

The part that relates to the local authority’s area
An internal drainage board for an internal drainage district that is wholly or partly in Wales
The part that relates to its district, so far as that district is in Wales
A water company that exercises functions in relation to an area in Wales
The part that relates to that area
A highway authority that exercises functions in relation to highways in Wales
The part that relates to the area in Wales in relation to which it exercises functions
A navigation authority that exercises functions in relation to an area in Wales
The part that relates to that area

P2para.Text: The Documentary Evidence Act 1868 has effect as if—

P3para.Text: the NRBW were mentioned in the first column of the Schedule to that Act;
any member of the staff of the NRBW authorised to act on behalf of the NRBW were specified in the second column of the Schedule to that Act in connection with the NRBW;
the regulation referred to in that Act included the main river map for Wales kept by the NRBW;
references to a copy included references to a print-out of information kept in electronic form.

P1group.Title: Replacing the main river map for Wales

P2para.Text: The NRBW may at any time replace the existing main river map for Wales for the purpose of including—

P3para.Text: a change which, pursuant to section 194(2)(b), is required by the making, amendment or revocation of a scheme under section 137,
a change to give effect to a determination under section 194C, or
a change directed by the Welsh Ministers under section 194D(5) (following an appeal against a determination).

P2para.Text: A replacement map may not include other changes.
A replacement map must specify the date on which it takes effect.
Subject to the following provisions of this section, the NRBW may determine that—

P3para.Text: such watercourse or part of a watercourse in Wales as is specified in the determination is to be treated for the purposes of this Act as a main river or part of a main river;

such watercourse or part of a watercourse in Wales as is specified in the determination (not being a watercourse designated in a scheme made under section 137) is no longer to be treated for the purposes of this Act as a main river or part of a main river.

P2para.Text: Before making a determination under subsection (1) as regards a watercourse, the NRBW must—

P3para.Text: publish (in such manner as it considers appropriate) the determination it proposes to make, and
consider representations made within the time and in the manner specified by the NRBW when publishing the determination.

P2para.Text: The NRBW must consult the Agency before making a determination under subsection (1)—

P3para.Text: which affects a watercourse part of which is in Wales and part of which is in England, and
in which it seems to the NRBW that the Agency has an interest.

P2para.Text: Having taken such steps as are required by subsections (2) and (3), the NRBW may—

P3para.Text: decide not to make a determination, or
decide to make a determination in accordance with what was proposed under subsection (2)(a) or otherwise.

P2para.Text: The NRBW must publish (in such manner as it considers appropriate)—

P3para.Text: that decision;
the terms of any determination made;
if a determination is made, the date on which a replacement map will give effect to the determination.

P2para.Text: The date specified under subsection (5)(c) may not be before the end of a period of six weeks beginning with the day on which the matters specified in subsection (5) are published.

The NRBW must also inform those persons affected by the proposal who made representations in accordance with subsection (2)(b) containing an objection to the proposal as to the matters referred to in subsection (5).
A person aggrieved by a determination under section 194C may appeal to the Welsh Ministers.
An appeal must be made before the end of a period of six weeks beginning with the day on which the matters referred to in section 194C(5) are published.
Where an appeal is made against a determination, a replacement map under section 194B may not include a change to give effect to the determination except as specified in this section.
The Welsh Ministers may appoint a person to make a report to assist them in determining the appeal.
If the Welsh Ministers allow the appeal in whole or in part, they may by direction to the NRBW—

P3para.Text: specify a change to be included in a replacement map under section 194B, and
specify the date on which that change is to take effect.

P2para.Text: If the Welsh Ministers dismiss the appeal, the NRBW may include a change to give effect to its determination in a replacement map, the replacement map to have effect on such date as the Welsh Ministers may direct.
The Welsh Ministers may direct the NRBW to publish their decision in such manner as the direction may specify.
The Welsh Ministers may from time to time issue guidance to the NRBW about the exercise of its functions under sections 194 to 194D.
The guidance may in particular include guidance as to—

P3para.Text: determining whether or not a watercourse or part of a watercourse is suitable to become or to remain a main river or a part of a main river;
what kind of publication is appropriate under section 194C(2) and (5).

P2para.Text: The NRBW must have regard to the guidance in carrying out its functions under sections 194 to 194D.

In section 113 (interpretation of Part 4), in subsection (1), in the definition of “main river”, for “a main river map” there is substituted “the main river map for England or the main river map for Wales”.
In section 221 (interpretation of the Act), in subsection (1)—

P2para.Text: Section 195 of the Water Resources Act 1991 (duty of appropriate agency to keep records of location of waterworks) is repealed.
In Schedule 23 to that Act (mineral rights), in paragraph 7(2) (structures and underground works which comprise appropriate agency’s undertaking), for paragraph (b) there is substituted—

P3para.Text: any resource mains, discharge pipes or other underground works which are for the time being vested in the appropriate agency.

P2para.Text: The Minister may by regulations make provision for any of the purposes listed in Part 1 of Schedule 8; and Part 2 of that Schedule has effect for supplementing Part 1.
Except as provided in Schedule 8, any provision so made is to be provision for or in connection with—

P3para.Text: regulating the use of water resources,
securing the drainage of land or the management of flood risk, or
safeguarding the movement of fish through regulated waters.

P2para.Text: In making regulations under this section, the Minister is to have regard to the desirability of reducing burdens by ensuring that so far as is reasonably practicable any system established by regulations under this section is combined with, or is consistent with, systems for regulating activities or other matters that cause pollution.
Regulations under this section may—

P3para.Text: contain such consequential, incidental, supplementary, transitional or saving provisions (including provisions amending, repealing or revoking enactments) as the Minister considers appropriate, and
make different provision for different cases, including different provision in relation to different persons, circumstances, areas or localities.

P2para.Text: Before making any regulations under this section, the Minister is to consult—

P3para.Text: the Environment Agency;
the Natural Resources Body for Wales;

such bodies or persons appearing to the Minister to be representative of the interests of local government, industry, agriculture and small businesses respectively as the Minister may consider appropriate;
such other bodies or persons as the Minister may consider appropriate.

P2para.Text: It is immaterial for the purposes of subsection (5) whether consultation is carried out before or after the coming into force of this section.
The Secretary of State’s power to make regulations under this section is subject to the consent of the Scottish Ministers so far as the regulations apply as mentioned in subsection (11)(b),
In this section and Schedule 8 a reference to the use of water resources—

P3para.Text: includes a reference to taking, diverting or impounding water from any inland waters, or taking water contained in underground strata, and applying it to any purpose, and
includes a reference to wasting water whether by action or omission, but

does not include a reference to the use, by a person other than a water undertaker, of water drawn from a water mains or pipe forming part of a system used by a water undertaker in carrying out a duty under section 37 of the Water Industry Act 1991.

P2para.Text: In this section and Schedule 8—

Para.Text: “enactment” includes—
an enactment contained in subordinate legislation within the meaning of the Interpretation Act 1978;
an enactment contained in, or an instrument made under, an Act of the Scottish Parliament;
an enactment contained in, or in an instrument made under, an Act or Measure of the National Assembly for Wales;
“fish” means freshwater fish and migratory fish;
“flood” has the meaning given in section 1 of the Flood and Water Management Act 2010;
“flood risk” has the meaning given in section 2 of that Act;
“freshwater fish” means any fish habitually living in fresh water;

“migratory fish” means fish of a kind which migrates from fresh to salt water, or from salt to fresh water, in order to spawn;
“the Minister” means—

the Welsh Ministers in relation to Wales;

inland waters in England and Wales,
the waters of so much of the River Esk and its tributary streams up to their source as is mentioned in subsection (11)(b), and
waters adjoining the coast of England and Wales to a distance of six nautical miles measured from the baselines from which the breadth of the territorial sea is measured;
“Wales” has the meaning given in section 158(1) of the Government of Wales Act 2006.

P2para.Text: The reference in subsection (8)(a) to water contained in underground strata is to be read in accordance with section 221(3) of the Water Resources Act 1991, as if this section formed part of that Act.
Regulations made in reliance on subsection (2)(c)—

P3para.Text: are not to apply in relation to the Tweed district (as defined in article 2(1) of the Scotland Act 1998 (River Tweed) Order 2006 (S.I. 2006/2913)), but
may apply in relation to so much of the River Esk, with its banks and tributary streams up to their source, as is situated in Scotland.

P2para.Text: Regulations under this section may make provision applying in relation to (and to places above and below) the territorial waters adjacent to any part of England and Wales.
The power to make regulations under section 44 is to be exercised by statutory instrument.
A statutory instrument containing regulations made by the Secretary of State under section 44 is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament, subject as follows.

P3para.Text: the first regulations to be made by the Secretary of State under section 44;
the first regulations to be made by the Welsh Ministers under section 44;
regulations under section 44 which create an offence or increase a penalty for an existing offence;
regulations under section 44 which amend or repeal any provision of an Act, or an Act or Measure of the National Assembly for Wales.

P2para.Text: A statutory instrument containing regulations made by the Secretary of State under both section 44 above and section 2 of the Pollution Prevention and Control Act 1999 is subject to the affirmative resolution procedure if an instrument containing only—

P3para.Text: the regulations made by the Secretary of State under section 44 above, or
the regulations made by the Secretary of State under section 2 of the Pollution Prevention and Control Act 1999,

P2para.Text: would be subject to the affirmative resolution procedure.

A statutory instrument containing regulations made by the Welsh Ministers under both section 44 above and section 2 of the Pollution Prevention and Control Act 1999 is subject to the affirmative resolution procedure if an instrument containing only—

P3para.Text: the regulations made by the Welsh Ministers under section 44 above, or
the regulations made by the Welsh Ministers under section 2 of the Pollution Prevention and Control Act 1999,

P2para.Text: would be subject to the affirmative resolution procedure.

A statutory instrument containing regulations made by the Secretary of State that is subject to the affirmative resolution procedure may not be made unless a draft of the instrument has been laid before, and approved by a resolution of, each House of Parliament.
A statutory instrument containing regulations made by the Welsh Ministers that is subject to the affirmative resolution procedure may not be made unless
a draft of the instrument has been laid before, and approved by a resolution of, the National Assembly for Wales.
Subsections (11) and (12) apply in relation to a statutory instrument containing both—

P3para.Text: regulations under section 44 made or to be made by the Secretary of State, and
regulations under section 44 made or to be made by the Welsh Ministers.

P2para.Text: Subsections (11) and (12) also apply in relation to a statutory instrument containing—

P3para.Text: regulations under section 44 made or to be made by the Secretary of State,
regulations under section 44 made or to be made by the Welsh Ministers, and
regulations made under section 2 of the Pollution Prevention and Control Act 1999 (whether by the Secretary of State or the Welsh Ministers or both).

P2para.Text: If in accordance with subsection (2) or (3) (negative resolution procedure)—

P3para.Text: either House of Parliament resolves that an address be presented to Her Majesty praying that an instrument containing regulations made by the Secretary of State be annulled, or

P2para.Text: nothing further is to be done under the instrument after the date of the resolution and Her Majesty may by Order in Council revoke the instrument.

P1group.Title: Internal drainage boards: procedure for orders confirming reorganisation

But this paragraph does not apply to an order made by the Secretary of State confirming a scheme under section 3 of this Act.

P1group.Title: Internal drainage boards in England: alternative procedure for byelaws

In section 65 (land drainage regulations), at the beginning of subsection (2) there is inserted “Subject to section 66A(4),”.

After section 66 there is inserted—

P1group.Title: Alternative procedure for byelaws made by internal drainage boards

P3para.Text: provide that section 66(5) and Schedule 5 do not apply to byelaws made under section 66 by internal drainage boards for internal drainage districts which are neither wholly nor partly in Wales, and
make provision about the procedure for the making and coming into force of such byelaws.

P2para.Text: The regulations may, in particular, include provision about—

P2para.Text: The regulations may make such incidental, consequential, transitional or supplemental provision (including provision amending or repealing any provision of this Act) as the Secretary of State considers appropriate.

P1group.Title: Operation of the authorisations in England and Wales

P1para.Text: In the descriptions of the following authorisations, a reference to the supply system of a water undertaker is a reference to the supply system of a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England—

P3para.Text: a retail authorisation;
a wholesale authorisation.

P1para.Text: In the descriptions of the following authorisations, a reference to the supply system of a water undertaker is a reference to the supply system of a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales—

P3para.Text: a restricted retail authorisation;
a supplementary authorisation.

P1para.Text: A retail authorisation given by a water supply licence is an authorisation to the water supply licensee to use the supply system of a water undertaker for the purpose of supplying water to the premises of—

P3para.Text: the licensee,
persons associated with the licensee, or
the licensee’s customers.

P1para.Text: None of the premises supplied by a water supply licensee under a retail authorisation may be household premises (as defined in section 17C).
A wholesale authorisation given by a water supply licence is an authorisation to the water supply licensee to introduce water into the supply system of a water undertaker—

P3para.Text: by means of which system any particular supply in accordance with a retail authorisation (whether the licensee’s or another water supply licensee’s) is to take place, and
where that introduction is to be made in connection with that intended supply.

P1para.Text: A restricted retail authorisation given by a water supply licence is an authorisation to the water supply licensee to use the supply system of a water undertaker for the purpose of supplying water to the premises of the licensee’s customers.
The following requirements must be satisfied in relation to each of the premises to be supplied by a water supply licensee under a restricted retail authorisation—

P3para.Text: the requirement that the premises are not household premises (as defined in section 17C);
the threshold requirement (construed in accordance with section 17D).

P1para.Text: A supplementary authorisation given by a water supply licence is an authorisation to the water supply licensee to introduce water into the supply system of a water undertaker—

P3para.Text: by means of which system any particular supply in accordance with the licensee’s restricted retail authorisation is to take place, and
where that introduction is to be made in connection with that intended supply.

P1para.Text: The requirements in paragraphs 4 and 7 are enforceable by the Authority under section 18.

P2para.Text: The Authority may from time to time, with the approval of the Secretary of State, issue guidance as to the factors that are, or are not, to be taken into account in determining the extent of any premises for the purposes of paragraphs 4 and 7.
Before giving approval under sub-paragraph (1) the Secretary of State must consult the Welsh Ministers.

P1para.Text: For the purposes of this Schedule, a person (A) is associated with a water supply licensee (L) if—

P3para.Text: where A and L are bodies corporate, one of them is a subsidiary of the other or both are subsidiaries of the same body corporate;

where A or L is an individual or an unincorporated association and the other is a body corporate, that individual or unincorporated association controls the other or a body corporate of which the other is a subsidiary;
A is a partnership of which L is a member.

P1para.Text: In paragraph 11 “subsidiary” has the meaning given by section 1159 of the Companies Act 2006; and sections 450(1) to (4) and 451(1) to (3) of the Corporation Taxes Act 2010 (control of a company) apply for the purposes of paragraph 13 as they apply for the purposes of Part 10 of that Act.”

TitleBlock.Title: Water undertakers’ duties as regards water supply licensees

P1para.Text: For sections 66A to 66C of the Water Industry Act 1991, and the Chapter heading and italic heading preceding section 66A, there is substituted—

Text.SmallCaps: Supply duties etc: water supply licensees

Pblock.Title: Duties of undertakers to supply water supply licensees etc

P1group.Title: Use of water undertaker’s supply system

P2para.Text: This section applies where a water supply licensee with a retail authorisation (“L”) requests a water undertaker to permit the use of the undertaker’s supply system for the purpose of supplying water to premises that—

P3para.Text: L is to supply in accordance with L’s retail authorisation, and
are in the area of the undertaker.

P2para.Text: This section also applies where a water supply licensee with a restricted retail authorisation (“R”) requests a water undertaker to permit the use of the undertaker’s supply system for the purpose of supplying water to premises that—

P3para.Text: R is to supply in accordance with R’s restricted retail authorisation, and
are in the area of the undertaker.

P2para.Text: Where this section applies, the undertaker must in accordance with a section 66D agreement take such steps—

P3para.Text: for the purpose of connecting the premises in question with the undertaker’s supply system, or
in respect of that system,

P2para.Text: as may be provided for in that agreement in order to enable the requested use of the undertaker’s supply system.
A water undertaker is not required by this section to permit the use of its supply system, or to take any steps to enable its use, if the first or second ground applies.
The first ground is that—

P3para.Text: in the case of a request under subsection (1), the water supply licensee has not secured by means of—

P4para.Text: a request under section 66AA(1) made by the licensee,
a request under section 66B(1) or 66C(1), (2) or (3) made by the licensee or another water supply licensee, or
a combination of such requests,

P3para.Text: a supply of water, or the introduction of a supply of water, in connection with which the premises in question are to be supplied;
in the case of a request under subsection (2), the water supply licensee has not secured by means of—

P4para.Text: a request under section 66AA(2), 66B(2) or (3) or 66C(4), or
a combination of such requests,
