P3para.Text: a supply of water, or the introduction of a supply of water, in connection with which the premises in question are to be supplied.

P2para.Text: The second ground is that there is in relation to the water fittings used or to be used in connection with—

P3para.Text: the supply of water to the premises in question, or
the use of water in those premises,

P2para.Text: a contravention of such of the requirements of regulations under section 74 as are prescribed for the purposes of this subsection.
Where—

P3para.Text: a request has been made by a water supply licensee for the purposes of subsection (1) or (2), and

the steps which the undertaker is required to take by virtue of that request include steps for the purpose of obtaining any necessary authority for, or agreement to, any exercise by it of any of its powers or the carrying out by it of any works,

P2para.Text: the failure of the undertaker to acquire the necessary authority or agreement does not affect the liability of the licensee to reimburse the undertaker in respect of some or all of expenses incurred by it in taking those steps, if the section 66D agreement provides for such liability as regards those steps.
In this section and sections 66AA to 66C—

P3para.Text: “prescribed” means, in relation to a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales, prescribed by regulations made by the Welsh Ministers by statutory instrument, which is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of the Assembly;
a reference to the supply system of a water undertaker is to be construed in accordance with section 17B;
references to a retail authorisation or a restricted retail authorisation are to be construed in accordance with Schedule 2A.

P2para.Text: This section applies where a water supply licensee with a retail authorisation (“L”) requests a water undertaker to provide L with a supply of water for the purpose of supplying water to premises that—

P3para.Text: L is to supply in accordance with L’s retail authorisation, and
are in the area of the undertaker.

P2para.Text: This section also applies where a water supply licensee with a restricted retail authorisation (“R”) requests a water undertaker to provide R with a supply of water for the purpose of supplying water to premises that—

P3para.Text: R is to supply in accordance with R’s restricted retail authorisation, and
are in the area of the undertaker.

P2para.Text: Where this section applies, the undertaker must in accordance with a section 66D agreement—

P3para.Text: take such steps in respect of the undertaker’s supply system as may be provided for in that agreement in order to enable the use of the undertaker’s supply system for the purpose in subsection (1) or, as the case may be, subsection (2), and
having taken such steps, provide the requested supply of water.

P2para.Text: A water undertaker is not required by this section to provide a supply of water if both of the first and second grounds apply.
The first ground is that—

P3para.Text: the premises to be supplied by L or, as the case may be, R do not consist in the whole or any part of a building, or
the supply to be made by L or, as the case may be, R to those premises is for purposes other than domestic purposes.

P2para.Text: The second ground is that provision of a supply of water by the water undertaker would—

P3para.Text: require the undertaker, in order to meet all its existing obligations to supply water for domestic or other purposes, together with its probable future obligations to supply buildings and parts of buildings with water for domestic purposes, to incur unreasonable expenditure in carrying out works, or
otherwise put at risk its ability to meet any of the existing or probable future obligations mentioned in paragraph (a).

P2para.Text: Where—

P3para.Text: a request has been made by a water supply licensee for the purposes of subsection (1) or (2), and

the steps which the undertaker is required to take by virtue of that request include steps for the purpose of obtaining any necessary authority for, or agreement to, any exercise by it of any of its powers or the carrying out by it of any works,

P2para.Text: the failure of the undertaker to acquire the necessary authority or agreement does not affect the liability of the licensee to reimburse the undertaker in respect of some or all of expenses incurred by it in taking those steps, if the section 66D agreement provides for such liability as regards those steps.

P1group.Title: Introduction of water into water undertaker’s supply system

P2para.Text: This section applies where—

P3para.Text: a water supply licensee with a wholesale authorisation (“L”) requests a water undertaker to permit L to introduce water into the undertaker’s supply system, with a view to the use of that system, in connection with that introduction of water, to supply water to particular premises in accordance with a retail authorisation (whether L’s or another’s), and
the premises in issue are in the area of the undertaker.

P2para.Text: This section also applies where—

P3para.Text: a water supply licensee with a supplementary authorisation (“R1”) requests a water undertaker to permit R1 to introduce water into the undertaker’s supply system, with a view to the use of that system, in connection with that introduction of water, to supply water to particular premises in accordance with R1’s restricted retail authorisation, and
the premises in issue are in the area of the undertaker.

P2para.Text: This section also applies where—

P3para.Text: a water undertaker agrees to permit a water supply licensee with a supplementary authorisation (“R2”) to introduce water into the undertaker’s treatment works,

in connection with that introduction, R2 requests the undertaker to permit R2 to introduce water into the undertaker’s supply system, with a view to the use of that system to supply water to particular premises in accordance with R2’s restricted retail authorisation, and
the premises in issue are in the area of the undertaker.

P2para.Text: Where this section applies, the undertaker must in accordance with a section 66D agreement—

P3para.Text: in a case falling within subsection (1), take such steps—

P4para.Text: for the purpose of connecting L’s source of water with the undertaker’s supply system, or
in respect of the undertaker’s supply system,

P3para.Text: as may be provided for in that agreement in order to enable L to make the requested introduction of water into the supply system;
in a case falling within subsection (2), take such steps—

P4para.Text: for the purpose of connecting R1’s treatment works with the undertaker’s supply system,
for the purpose of connecting with the undertaker’s supply system any source used by R1 for the purpose of supplying water other than for domestic or food purposes, or
in respect of the undertaker’s supply system,

P3para.Text: as may be provided for in that agreement in order to enable R1 to make the requested introduction of water into the supply system;

in a case falling within subsection (3), take such steps in respect of the undertaker’s supply system as may be provided for in that agreement in order to enable R2 to make the requested introduction of water into the supply system;
having taken steps under paragraph (a), (b) or (c) (as the case may be), permit the requested introduction of water into that supply system.

P2para.Text: A water undertaker is not required by this section to permit the introduction of water into its supply system, or to take any steps to enable such an introduction of water, if permitting the introduction of water into the undertaker’s supply system would—

P3para.Text: require the undertaker, in order to meet all its existing obligations to supply water for domestic or other purposes,
together with its probable future obligations to supply buildings and parts of buildings with water for domestic purposes, to incur unreasonable expenditure in carrying out works, or
otherwise put at risk its ability to meet any of the existing or probable future obligations mentioned in paragraph (a).

P2para.Text: Where—

P3para.Text: a request has been made by a water supply licensee for the purposes of subsection (1), (2) or (3), and

the steps which the undertaker is required to take by virtue of that request include steps for the purpose of obtaining any necessary authority for, or agreement to, any exercise by it of any of its powers or the carrying out by it of any works,

P2para.Text: the failure of the undertaker to acquire the necessary authority or agreement does not affect the liability of the licensee to reimburse the undertaker in respect of some or all of expenses incurred by it in taking those steps, if the terms and conditions of the section 66D agreement provide for such liability as regards those steps.
In this section “treatment works” means—

P3para.Text: in relation to a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales, the works designated as treatment works by the Secretary of State for the purposes of section 17B(6);
in relation to a water supply licensee, the works designated from time to time by the Welsh Ministers as treatment works for the purposes of this paragraph.

P2para.Text: A list of any works designated for the purposes of subsection (7)(b) must be published from time to time by the Welsh Ministers in such manner as the Welsh Ministers consider appropriate for the purpose of bringing the designations to the attention of persons likely to be affected by them.
A pipe laid because of subsection (4)(a)(i) or (b)(i) or (ii) is to be regarded as a water main for the purposes of this Act, subject to any provision to the contrary.
In this section and section 66C—

P3para.Text: a reference to a wholesale authorisation is to be construed in accordance with Schedule 2A;
a reference to a supplementary authorisation is to be construed in accordance with Schedule 2A.

P1group.Title: Introduction of water provided by secondary water undertaker

P2para.Text: This section applies where a water supply licensee with a wholesale authorisation (“L1”)—

P3para.Text: requests a water undertaker other than L1’s primary water undertaker (the “secondary water undertaker”) to provide a supply of water so that water may be supplied to particular premises, using the primary water undertaker’s supply system and in accordance with a retail authorisation (whether L1’s or another’s), and
requests L1’s primary water undertaker to permit L1 to introduce that water into the primary water undertaker’s supply system,

P2para.Text: and the premises in issue are in the area of the primary water undertaker.
A request under paragraph (a) may only be made to a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England.
A request under paragraph (a) may only be made to a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England.
This section also applies where a water supply licensee with a wholesale authorisation (“L2”)—

P3para.Text: requests a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales and which is not L2’s primary water undertaker (the “secondary water undertaker”) to provide a supply of water so that L2 may supply water to particular premises, using the primary water undertaker’s supply system and in accordance with L2’s retail authorisation so far as that authorisation relates to L2’s customers, and
requests L2’s primary water undertaker to permit L2 to introduce that water into the primary water undertaker’s supply system,

P2para.Text: and the premises in issue are in the area of the primary water undertaker.
This section also applies where a water supply licensee with a wholesale authorisation (“L3”)—

P3para.Text: agrees with a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales and which is not L3’s primary undertaker (the “secondary water undertaker”) for the secondary water undertaker to provide a supply of water so that water may be supplied to particular premises, using the primary water undertaker’s supply system and in accordance with—

P4para.Text: L3’s retail authorisation except so far as that authorisation relates to L3’s customers, or
a retail authorisation other than L3’s, and

P3para.Text: requests L3’s primary water undertaker to permit L3 to introduce that water into the primary water undertaker’s supply system,

P2para.Text: and the premises in issue are in the area of the primary water undertaker.
This section also applies where a water supply licensee with a supplementary authorisation (“R”)—

P3para.Text: requests a water undertaker other than R’s primary water undertaker (the “secondary water undertaker”) to provide a supply of water so that R may supply water to particular premises, using the primary water undertaker’s supply system and in accordance with R’s restricted retail authorisation, and
requests R’s primary water undertaker to permit R to introduce that water into the primary water undertaker’s supply system,

P2para.Text: and the premises in issue are in the area of the primary water undertaker.
A request under paragraph (a) may be made to a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England or Wales.
A request under paragraph (a) may be made to a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England or Wales.
Where this section applies by virtue of subsection (1), (2) or (4), the secondary water undertaker must in accordance with a section 66D agreement—

P3para.Text: take such steps in respect of its supply system as may be provided for in that agreement in order to enable it to provide the requested supply, and
having taken such steps, provide that supply.

P2para.Text: Where this section applies, the primary water undertaker must in accordance with a section 66D agreement—

P3para.Text: take such steps—

P4para.Text: for the purpose of connecting the secondary water undertaker’s supply system with the primary water undertaker’s supply system, or
in respect of its supply system,

P3para.Text: as may be provided for in that agreement in order to enable L1, L2, L3 or R to make the requested introduction of water into the primary undertaker’s supply system, and
having taken such steps, permit the requested introduction.

P2para.Text: A secondary water undertaker is not required by this section to provide a supply of water to L1, L2 or R if providing the supply of water would—

P3para.Text: require the secondary undertaker, in order to meet all its existing obligations to supply water for domestic or other purposes, together with its probable future obligations to supply buildings and parts of buildings with water for domestic purposes, to incur unreasonable expenditure in carrying out works, or
otherwise put at risk its ability to meet any of the existing or probable future obligations mentioned in paragraph (a).

P2para.Text: A primary water undertaker is not required by this section to permit the introduction of water into its supply system, or to take any steps to enable such an introduction of water, if permitting the introduction of a supply of water would—

P3para.Text: require the primary undertaker, in order to meet all its existing obligations to supply water for domestic or other purposes, together with its probable future obligations to supply buildings and parts of buildings with water for domestic purposes, to incur unreasonable expenditure in carrying out works, or
otherwise put at risk its ability to meet any of the existing or probable future obligations mentioned in paragraph (a).

P2para.Text: Where—

P3para.Text: a request has been made by a water supply licensee to a water undertaker for the purposes of subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4), and
the steps which the undertaker is required to take by virtue of that request include steps for the purpose of obtaining any
necessary authority for, or agreement to, any exercise by it of any of its powers or the carrying out by it of any works,

P2para.Text: the failure of the undertaker to acquire the necessary authority or agreement does not affect the liability of the licensee to reimburse the undertaker in respect of some or all of expenses incurred by it in taking those steps, if the terms and conditions of the section 66D agreement provide for such liability as regards those steps.
A pipe laid because of subsection (6)(a)(i) is to be regarded as a water main for the purposes of this Act, subject to any provision to the contrary.

For the purposes of this section, a water undertaker is the primary water undertaker of a water supply licensee if the undertaker’s supply system is to be used for the purpose of making the supply to the premises mentioned in subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4).

P1para.Text: After section 66C (substituted by paragraph 1) there is inserted—

P2para.Text: The Authority may determine, in a case referred to it by a water supply licensee, whether any condition specified in the following provisions is satisfied—

P3para.Text: section 66A(5) and (6);
section 66AA(5) and (6);
section 66B(5);
section 66C(7) and (8).

P2para.Text: Before the Authority determines whether a condition specified in section 66B(5) is satisfied, it must consult the Secretary of State.

If a determination as to a condition specified in section 66B(5) relates to the introduction of water into the supply system of a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales, the Authority must consult the Welsh Ministers, not the Secretary of State.
Before the Authority determines whether a condition specified in section 66C(7) or (8) is satisfied, it must consult the Secretary of State and the appropriate agency.
If the case in which a determination as to a condition specified in section 66C(7) or (8) is made relates to—

P3para.Text: the supply of water by a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales, and
the introduction of water into the supply system of a water undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in Wales,

P2para.Text: the Authority must consult the Welsh Ministers, not the Secretary of State.

If the case in which a determination as to a condition specified in section 66C(7) or (8) is made relates to the supply of water by one water undertaker, and the introduction of water into the supply system of another water undertaker, and only one of those undertakers has an area wholly or mainly in Wales, the Authority must consult the Welsh Ministers as well as the Secretary of State.

In subsection (4), “the appropriate agency”, in relation to a determination as to a condition specified in section 66C(7) or (8) relating to the supply of water by one water undertaker, and the introduction of water into the supply system of another water undertaker means—

P3para.Text: the Environment Agency, in a case where the areas of both undertakers are wholly in England;
the NRBW, in a case where the areas of both undertakers are wholly in Wales;
both the Environment Agency and the NRBW, in any other case.

P1para.Text: For section 66D of the Water Industry Act 1991 (determinations and agreements) there is substituted—

P1group.Title: Agreements as to duties under sections 66A to 66C

P2para.Text: On the application of—

P3para.Text: a water supply licensee that has made a request under sections 66A to 66C, or
a water undertaker to which such a request has been made,

P2para.Text: the Authority may by order require a water undertaker to perform the duty in question under sections 66A to 66C, for such period and on such terms and conditions as may be specified in the order.
The Authority may make an order under subsection (1) only if—

P3para.Text: in the case of an application relating to a duty under section 66A, 66AA, 66B or 66C, it appears to the Authority that the water undertaker is required to perform that duty under that section, or
in the case of an application relating to duties under section 66C, it appears to the Authority that both water undertakers in question are required to perform duties under that section,

P2para.Text: and it is satisfied that the parties cannot reach agreement within a reasonable time.
An order under subsection (1) has effect as an agreement between—

P3para.Text: the water supply licensee, and
the water undertaker required to perform the duty in question.

P2para.Text: On the application of a party to a section 66D agreement, and if the Authority is satisfied that the parties cannot reach agreement on the variation or termination of the agreement within a reasonable time, the Authority may by order vary or terminate the agreement.
If an order under subsection (4) is made in relation to a section 66D agreement, the agreement—

P3para.Text: has effect subject to the provision made by the order, or
ceases to have effect, as the case may be.

P2para.Text: An order under subsection (4) may require one party to the agreement to pay compensation to the other.
Neither the CMA nor the Authority may exercise, in respect of an agreement for the performance of a duty under sections 66A to 66C by a water undertaker, the powers conferred by—

P3para.Text: section 32 of the Competition Act 1998 (directions in relation to agreements);
section 35(2) of that Act (interim directions).

P2para.Text: Subsection (7)(b) does not apply to the exercise of powers in respect of conduct—

P3para.Text: which is connected with an agreement for the performance of a duty under sections 66A to 66C by a water undertaker, and

in respect of which section 35(1) of the Competition Act 1998 applies because of an investigation under section 25 of that Act relating to a suspected infringement of the Chapter 2 prohibition imposed by section 18(1) of that Act.

P2para.Text: In this Chapter a reference to a section 66D agreement is a reference to—

P3para.Text: an agreement for the performance of a duty under sections 66A to 66C by a water undertaker, or
an order deemed to be such an agreement under subsection (3), or
an agreement varied by order under subsection (4).

P1para.Text: After section 66D of the Water Industry Act 1991 (as substituted by paragraph 3) there is inserted—

P1group.Title: Codes in respect of section 66D agreements

P2para.Text: The Authority may issue one or more codes in respect of section 66D agreements.
A code may make provision about—

P3para.Text: procedures in connection with making a section 66D agreement;
procedures in connection with varying or terminating a section 66D agreement;
the terms and conditions of a section 66D agreement, including terms as to the duration of such an agreement;
principles for determining the terms and conditions that should or should not be incorporated into a section 66D agreement.

P2para.Text: A code may make provision about the steps to be taken by the Authority in determining for the purposes of section 66D(2) whether a water undertaker is, in the particular case, required to perform a duty under sections 66A to 66C.

If the Authority considers that a water undertaker or a water supply licensee is not acting as required by a code, the Authority may give the undertaker or the licensee a direction to do, or not to do, a thing specified in the direction.
The Authority may not give a direction under subsection (4) requiring a person to enter into, vary or terminate an agreement.
It is the duty of a water undertaker or a water supply licensee to comply with a direction under subsection (4), and this duty is enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
A code may make—

P3para.Text: different provision for different persons or descriptions of person;
different provision for different duties under sections 66A to 66C.

P2para.Text: The Authority may from time to time review a code issued under this section and issue a revised code.
A revised code may include provision for applying any of its revisions to section 66D agreements made before the revised code comes into effect.
Before issuing a code under section 66DA, the Authority must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the code proposed to be issued;
consult persons in accordance with subsections (2) to (4).

P2para.Text: If the proposed code relates to section 66D agreements made with water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England, the Authority must consult the following about the proposed code—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water;
the Council;
any relevant undertakers likely to be affected by the proposed code;
any water supply licensees likely to be affected by the proposed code;
such other persons as the Authority thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: If the proposed code relates to section 66D agreements made with water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales, the Authority must consult the following about the proposed code—

P3para.Text: the Welsh Ministers;
the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water for Wales if there is one, or the Chief Inspector of Drinking Water if section 86(1B)(b) applies;
the Council;
any relevant undertakers likely to be affected by the proposed code;
any water supply licensees likely to be affected by the proposed code;
such other persons as the Authority thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Authority must specify the period (“the consultation period”) within which a person may make representations about the proposed code.
Before a code under section 66DA prepared by the Authority is issued, the Minister may direct the Authority—

P3para.Text: not to issue the code, or
to issue the code with specified modifications.

P2para.Text: Subsection (5) is subject to subsections (8) and (9).
In subsection (5) “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, so far as a code prepared by the Authority relates to section 66D agreements affecting only the supply systems of water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England;
the Welsh Ministers, so far as a code prepared by the Authority relates to section 66D agreements affecting only the supply systems of water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales;
the Secretary of State and the Welsh Ministers acting jointly, so far as a code prepared by the Authority relates to section 66D agreements not falling within paragraph (a) or (b).

P2para.Text: If the power under subsection (5) is exercised to give a direction in respect of such section 66D agreements as are referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) of subsection (7), it may not be exercised again in respect of such section 66D agreements as are referred to in that paragraph.

If the power under subsection (5) to give a direction in respect of such section 66D agreements as are referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) of subsection (7) is not exercised on the first occasion on which it may be so exercised, it may not be exercised in respect of such section 66D agreements as are referred to in that paragraph on a later occasion.

A direction under subsection (5) must be given within the period of 28 days beginning with the day after the end of the consultation period, and a code prepared by the Authority in relation to which a direction may be given may not be issued before that period of 28 days has expired.
This section is subject to section 66DC.

P1group.Title: Codes under section 66DA: minor or urgent revisions

P2para.Text: This section applies if the Authority proposes to issue a revised code and, in the view of the Authority, the revision or each of the revisions proposed to be made is—

P3para.Text: a revision for which consultation is unnecessary, or
a revision that it is necessary or desirable to make without delay.

P2para.Text: Section 66DB does not apply to the proposed revised code.
Once the Authority has issued the revised code, it must give notice as soon as reasonably practicable of—

P3para.Text: the issuing of the revised code, and
as regards each revision contained in it, whether in the view of the Authority the revision falls within paragraph (a) or (b) of subsection (1).

P2para.Text: Notice under subsection (3) is to be given to such persons as the Authority considers appropriate.

Unless the Authority gives notice that a revision in a revised code is in the view of the Authority a revision falling within subsection (1)(a), the revision ceases to have effect at the end of the period of six months beginning with the day after that on which the revised code is issued.

P1para.Text: For section 66E of that Act there is substituted—

P2para.Text: The Authority must issue rules about charges that may be imposed by a water undertaker under a section 66D agreement.
The rules may in particular make provision about—

P3para.Text: the types of charges that may be imposed;
the amount or the maximum amount, or methods for determining the amount or maximum amount, of any type of charge;
principles for determining what types of charges may or may not be imposed;
principles for determining the amount of any change that may be imposed.

P2para.Text: The rules must include provision for and in connection with requiring a water undertaker to impose on a water supply licensee only such charges as would enable the licensee, where the services it provides to a person under its retail authorisation or restricted retail authorisation are services to which a section 142(2)(b) agreement would apply if the undertaker had continued to provide the services, to charge for those services at the same rate or rates as would have applied if the section 142(2)(b) agreement had applied.
In subsection (3) “section 142(2)(b) agreement” means an agreement to which section 142(2)(b) applies.
If the Authority considers that a water undertaker is not acting as required by rules under this section, the Authority may—

P3para.Text: give the undertaker a direction to do, or not to do, a thing specified in the direction, or

in a case where a section 66D agreement to which the undertaker is party requires modification in order to conform to the rules, give a direction to the undertaker and the water supply licensee in question to modify the agreement.

P2para.Text: It is the duty of a water undertaker or a water supply licensee to comply with a direction under subsection (5), and this duty is enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
The rules may—

P3para.Text: make different provision for different persons or descriptions of person;
make different provision for different purposes;
make provision subject to exceptions.

P2para.Text: The Authority may from time to time review rules issued under this section and issue revised rules.
Revised rules may include provision for applying any of their revisions to section 66D agreements made before the revised rules come into effect.

P1group.Title: Rules about charges: provision about the reduction of charges

P2para.Text: Rules under section 66E may make provision about the reduction of charges payable under a section 66D agreement where—

P3para.Text: a water supply licensee that has a retail authorisation or a restricted retail authorisation is party to the section 66D agreement, and
other conditions specified by the rules are satisfied.

P2para.Text: Rules made by virtue of subsection (1) may in particular—

P3para.Text: specify conditions relating to any party to the section 66D agreement;
specify conditions about persons taking steps for the purpose of reducing or managing water consumption;
specify conditions about the premises by reference to which such steps are to be taken;
specify conditions about reducing charges payable by a person who—

P4para.Text: is not party to the section 66D agreement, and
takes or proposes to take such steps as satisfy or would satisfy a condition specified under paragraph (b).

P2para.Text: The rules may provide that, where a charge falls to be reduced in accordance with rules made by virtue of subsection (1), the water undertaker to which the charges are payable must give notice of that reduction to the Authority.
Rules made by virtue of subsection (3) may—

P3para.Text: make provision as to the content of the notice;
specify the period within which an undertaker is to give notice to the Authority.

P2para.Text: Provision under subsection (4)(a) may in particular require the notice to specify—

P3para.Text: the amount of the charge, with and without the reduction;
the period for which the reduction has effect.

P2para.Text: Before issuing rules under section 66E, the Authority must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed rules, and
consult the relevant persons about the draft.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the Welsh Ministers;
the Council;
any water undertakers likely to be affected by the rules;
any water supply licensees likely to be affected by the rules;
such other persons as the Authority thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Authority must specify the period (“the consultation period”) within which persons may make representations about the proposed rules.
The Authority must have regard to guidance issued under section 66EC in preparing rules under section 66E.
Before rules under section 66E prepared by the Authority are issued, the Minister may direct the Authority—

P3para.Text: not to issue the rules, or
to issue the rules with specified modifications.

P2para.Text: In subsection (5) “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, so far as rules prepared by the Authority relate to section 66D agreements affecting only the supply systems of water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England;
the Welsh Ministers, so far as rules prepared by the Authority relate to section 66D agreements affecting only the supply systems of water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales;
the Secretary of State and the Welsh Ministers acting jointly, so far as rules prepared by the Authority relate to section 66D agreements not falling within paragraph (a) or (b).

P2para.Text: A direction under subsection (5) must be given within the period of 28 days beginning with the day after the end of the consultation period, and rules may not be issued before that period of 28 days has expired.
Guidance as to the content of rules under section 66E must be issued by—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, in relation to section 66D agreements affecting only the supply systems of water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England, and
the Welsh Ministers, in relation to section 66D agreements affecting only the supply systems of water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales.

P2para.Text: Guidance as to the content of rules under section 66E may be issued by the Minister in relation to other section 66D agreements.
Before issuing the guidance, the Minister must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of any proposed guidance;
consult the relevant persons about the draft.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the Welsh Ministers;
such other persons as the Minister thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Minister may from time to time review guidance issued under this section and issue revised guidance.
Subsections (3) and (4) apply to revised guidance as they apply to the original guidance.
The Minister must arrange for the publication of guidance issued under this section.
In this section “the Minister” means—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, in relation to section 66D agreements affecting only the supply systems of water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in England;
the Welsh Ministers, in relation to section 66D agreements affecting only the supply systems of water undertakers whose areas are wholly or mainly in Wales;
the Secretary of State and the Welsh Ministers acting jointly, in relation to section 66D agreements not falling within paragraph (a) or (b).

P1para.Text: Section 66F (section 66D: supplementary) is repealed.

P2para.Text: Section 66G (designation of strategic supply) is amended as follows.
In subsection (1), for “an agreement under section 66D above” there is substituted “a section 66D agreement”.
In subsection (4)(d), for “the agreement under section 66D above” there is substituted “the section 66D agreement”.
In subsection (10)—

P3para.Text: for “section 66A” there is substituted “section 66AA”;
for “customers of the licensed water supplier in question” there is substituted “relevant customers of a water supply licensee”.

P2para.Text: After subsection (10) there is inserted—
A person is a relevant customer of a water supply licensee if the introduction of water in question is made by reference to the supply of water to that person’s premises in accordance with—

P3para.Text: a retail authorisation (whether that retail authorisation is an authorisation of the licensee requesting the introduction of water or another water supply licensee’s authorisation), or
a restricted retail authorisation of the licensee requesting the introduction of water.

P2para.Text: Section 66H (designation of collective strategic supply) is amended as follows.
In subsection (1)(b), for “agreements under section 66D above” there is substituted “section 66D agreements”.
In subsection (4)(d), for “the agreements under section 66D above” there is substituted “the section 66D agreements”.
In subsection (10)—

P3para.Text: for “section 66A” there is substituted “section 66AA”;
for “customers of the licensed water supplier in question” there is substituted “relevant customers of a water supply licensee”.

P2para.Text: After subsection (10) there is inserted—

A person is a relevant customer of a water supply licensee if an introduction of water is made by reference to the supply of water to that person’s premises in accordance with a retail authorisation (whether that retail authorisation is an authorisation of the licensee requesting the introduction of water or another water supply licensee’s authorisation) or a restricted retail authorisation of the licensee requesting the introduction of water.
Section 66I (prohibition on unauthorised use of supply system) is amended as follows.
In subsection (1), for “of a customer” there is substituted “of—

P3para.Text: a customer,
the person so using that system, or
a person associated with that person

P2para.Text: In subsection (2)(b)—

P3para.Text: for “licensed water supplier” there is substituted “water supply licensee”;
for “its licence” there is substituted “the licensee’s licence”.

P2para.Text: After subsection (8), there is inserted—
For the purposes of this section, a person (A) is associated with another person (B) if they would be associated with each other for the purposes of Schedule 2A if A were a water supply licensee.
In subsection (9), for “section 17B(5) above” there is substituted “section 17B”.

P1para.Text: A retail authorisation given by a sewerage licence is an authorisation to the sewerage licensee to use the sewerage system of a sewerage undertaker for the purpose of enabling the licensee to provide sewerage services in respect of the premises of—

P3para.Text: the licensee,
persons associated with the licensee, or
the licensee’s customers.

P1para.Text: None of the premises served by a sewerage licensee under a retail authorisation may be household premises (as defined in section 17C).
The requirement in paragraph 2 is enforceable by the Authority under section 18.

The Authority may from time to time, with the approval of the Secretary of State, issue guidance as to the factors which are, or are not, to be taken into account in determining the extent of any premises for the purposes of paragraph 2.
A wholesale authorisation given by a sewerage licence is an authorisation to the sewerage licensee to remove matter from the sewerage system of a sewerage undertaker where—

P3para.Text: the sewerage system is being used to enable a sewerage licensee (whether the licensee or another sewerage licensee) to provide sewerage services in respect of premises in accordance with a retail authorisation, and
the removing of matter from the sewerage system is done in connection with sewerage services so provided.

P1para.Text: A disposal authorisation given by a sewerage licence is an authorisation to the sewerage licensee to remove matter from the sewerage system of a sewerage undertaker.
If a sewerage licensee with a disposal authorisation has, or a person associated with the licensee has, a retail authorisation—

P3para.Text: the licensee or the person associated with it, or both of them, must obtain a wholesale authorisation, and

neither the licensee nor the person associated with it (if that person has a disposal authorisation) may remove matter from a sewerage system in accordance with the disposal authorisation (or either disposal authorisation, if both have such an authorisation) while matter may be removed in accordance with the wholesale authorisation (or either wholesale authorisation, if both have such an authorisation).

P1para.Text: For the purposes of this Schedule, a person (A) is associated with a sewerage licensee (L) if—

P3para.Text: where A and L are bodies corporate, one of them is a subsidiary of the other or both are subsidiaries of the same body corporate;

where A or L is an individual or an unincorporated association and the other is a body corporate, that individual or unincorporated association controls the other or a body corporate of which the other is a subsidiary;
A is a partnership of which L is a member.

P1para.Text: In paragraph 8 “subsidiary” has the meaning given by section 1159 of the Companies Act 2006; and sections 450(1) to (4) and 451(1) to (3) of the Corporation Taxes Act 2010 (control of a company) apply for the purposes of paragraph 11 as they apply for the purposes of Part 10 of that Act.”

TitleBlock.Title: Sewerage undertakers’ duties as regards sewerage licensees

P.Text: After Chapter 2 of Part 4 of the Water Industry Act 1991 there is inserted—

ERROR_Undefined_CenteredHeading.Text: Duties relating to sewerage services: sewerage licensees

Pblock.Title: Duties of sewerage undertakers as regards enabling the provision of sewerage services

P2para.Text: This section applies where a sewerage licensee with a retail authorisation (“L”) requests a sewerage undertaker to permit the use of the undertaker’s sewerage system for the purpose of enabling L to provide sewerage services to premises that—

P3para.Text: L is to serve in accordance with L’s retail authorisation, and
are in the area of the sewerage undertaker.

P2para.Text: Where this section applies, the undertaker must in accordance with a section 117E agreement take such steps—

P3para.Text: for the purpose of connecting the drains or sewers of the premises in question to the undertaker’s sewerage system, or
in respect of that system,

P2para.Text: as may be provided for in that agreement in order to enable the requested use of that system.

A sewerage undertaker is not required by this section to permit the use of its sewerage system, or to take any steps to enable its use, if the sewerage licensee making a request has not secured by means of—

P3para.Text: a request under section 117B made by the licensee, or
a request under section 117C made by the licensee or another sewerage licensee,

P2para.Text: that there is to be provision for dealing with or removing matter from the sewerage system in quantities determined by reference to the extent of sewerage services provided in respect of the premises in question.
Where—

P3para.Text: a request has been made by a sewerage licensee for the purposes of subsection (1), and

the steps which the undertaker is required to take by virtue of that request include steps for the purpose of obtaining any necessary authority for, or agreement to, any exercise by it of any of its powers or the carrying out by it of any works,

P2para.Text: the failure of the undertaker to acquire the necessary authority or agreement does not affect the liability of the licensee to reimburse the undertaker in respect of some or all of the expenses incurred by it in taking those steps, if the section 117E agreement provides for such liability as regards those steps.
In this section and sections 117B to 117C—

P3para.Text: references to the sewerage system of a sewerage undertaker are to be construed in accordance with section 17BA(7);
references to the retail authorisation of a sewerage licensee are to be construed in accordance with Schedule 2B.

P1group.Title: Matter dealt with by sewerage undertaker

P2para.Text: This section applies where a sewerage licensee with a retail authorisation (“L”) requests a sewerage undertaker to deal effectually with certain quantities of matter in its sewerage system in circumstances where—

P3para.Text: sewerage services are to be provided in accordance with L’s retail authorisation in respect of particular premises in the area of the undertaker, and
the quantities to be dealt with are to be determined by reference to the extent of sewerage services provided in respect of those premises.

P2para.Text: Where this section applies, the sewerage undertaker must in accordance with a section 117E agreement—

P3para.Text: take such steps in respect of the undertaker’s sewerage system as may be provided for in that agreement in order to enable the use of that system for the purpose in subsection (1), and
having taken those steps, deal with matter as requested.

P2para.Text: Where—

P3para.Text: a request has been made by a sewerage licensee for the purposes of subsection (1), and

the steps which the undertaker is required to take by virtue of that request include steps for the purpose of obtaining any necessary authority for, or agreement to, any exercise by it of any of its powers or the carrying out by it of any works,

P2para.Text: the failure of the undertaker to acquire the necessary authority or agreement does not affect the liability of the licensee to reimburse the undertaker in respect of some or all of the expenses incurred by it in taking those steps, if the section 117E agreement provides for such liability as regards those steps.

P1group.Title: Removal of matter from sewerage system by a sewerage licensee

P2para.Text: This section applies where a sewerage licensee with a wholesale authorisation (“L”) requests a sewerage undertaker to permit L to remove certain quantities of matter from the undertaker’s sewerage system in circumstances where—

P3para.Text: sewerage services are to be provided in accordance with a retail authorisation (whether L’s or another’s) in respect of particular premises in the area of the undertaker, and
the quantities to be removed are to be determined by reference to the extent of sewerage services provided in respect of those premises.

P2para.Text: Where this section applies, the sewerage undertaker must in accordance with a section 117E agreement—

P3para.Text: take such steps, including steps in respect of the undertaker’s sewerage system, as may be provided for in that agreement
in order to enable L to remove matter from the undertaker’s sewerage system as requested, and
having taken those steps, to permit that requested removal of matter from that sewerage system.

P2para.Text: Where—

P3para.Text: a request has been made by a sewerage licensee for the purposes of subsection (1), and

the steps which the undertaker is required to take by virtue of that request include steps for the purpose of obtaining any necessary authority for, or agreement to, any exercise by it of any of its powers or the carrying out by it of any works,

P2para.Text: the failure of the undertaker to acquire the necessary authority or agreement does not affect the liability of the licensee to reimburse the undertaker in respect of some or all of the expenses incurred by it in taking those steps, if the section 117E agreement provides for such liability as regards those steps.

A pipe connecting a sewerage undertaker’s sewerage system to a sewage disposal works that is laid because of subsection (2)(a) is to be regarded as a disposal main for the purposes of this Act, subject to any provision to the contrary.
In this section, a reference to a wholesale authorisation is to be construed in accordance with Schedule 2B.

P1group.Title: Connections for the purposes of a disposal authorisation

P2para.Text: This section applies where a sewerage licensee with a disposal authorisation (“L”) requests a sewerage undertaker to permit L to remove matter from the undertaker’s sewerage system.
Where this section applies, the sewerage undertaker must in accordance with a section 117E agreement—

P3para.Text: take such steps, including steps in respect of the undertaker’s sewerage system, as may be provided for in that agreement in order to enable L to remove matter from the undertaker’s sewerage system as requested, and
having taken those steps, to permit that requested removal of matter from that sewerage system.

P2para.Text: Where—

P3para.Text: a request has been made by a sewerage licensee for the purposes of subsection (1), and

the steps which the undertaker is required to take by virtue of that request include steps for the purpose of obtaining any necessary authority for, or agreement to, any exercise by it of any of its powers or the carrying out by it of any works,

P2para.Text: the failure of the undertaker to acquire the necessary authority or agreement does not affect the liability of the licensee to reimburse the undertaker in respect of some or all of the expenses incurred by it in taking those steps, if the section 117E agreement provides for such liability as regards those steps.
A pipe connecting a sewerage undertaker’s sewerage system to a sewage disposal works that is laid because of subsection (2)(a) is to
be regarded as a disposal main for the purposes of this Act, subject to any provision to the contrary.
In this section, a reference to a disposal authorisation is to be construed in accordance with Schedule 2B.

P1group.Title: Agreements as to duties under sections 117A to 117D

P2para.Text: On the application of—

P3para.Text: a sewerage licensee that has made a request under sections 117A to 117D, or
a sewerage undertaker to which such a request has been made,

P2para.Text: the Authority may by order require a sewerage undertaker to perform the duty in question under sections 117A to 117D, for such period and on such terms and conditions as may be specified in the order.
The Authority may make an order under subsection (1) only if—

P3para.Text: it appears to the Authority that the sewerage undertaker is required to perform the duty in question, and
it is satisfied that the parties cannot reach agreement within a reasonable time.

P2para.Text: An order under subsection (1) has effect as an agreement between—

P3para.Text: the sewerage licensee, and
the sewerage undertaker required to perform the duty in question.

P2para.Text: On the application of a party to a section 117E agreement, the Authority may, if it is satisfied that the parties cannot reach agreement on the variation or termination of the agreement, by order vary or terminate the agreement.
If an order under subsection (4) is made in relation to a section 117E agreement, the agreement—

P3para.Text: has effect subject to the provision made by the order, or
ceases to have effect, as the case may be.

P2para.Text: An order under subsection (4) may require one party to the agreement to pay compensation to the other.
Neither the CMA nor the Authority may exercise, in respect of an agreement for the performance of a duty under sections 117A to 117D by a sewerage undertaker, the powers conferred by—

P3para.Text: section 32 of the Competition Act 1998 (directions in relation to agreements);
section 35(2) of that Act (interim directions).

P2para.Text: Subsection (7)(b) does not apply to the exercise of powers in respect of conduct—

P3para.Text: which is connected with an agreement for the performance of a duty under sections 117A to 117D by a sewerage undertaker, and
in respect of which section 35(1) of the Competition Act 1998 applies because of an investigation under section 25 of that
Act relating to a suspected infringement of the Chapter 2 prohibition imposed by section 18(1) of that Act.

P2para.Text: In this Chapter a reference to a section 117E agreement is a reference to—

P3para.Text: an agreement for the performance of a duty under sections 117A to 117D by a sewerage undertaker, or
an order deemed to be such an agreement under subsection (3), or
an agreement varied by order under subsection (4).

P1group.Title: Codes in respect of section 117E agreements

P2para.Text: The Authority may issue one or more codes in respect of section 117E agreements.
A code may make provision about—

P3para.Text: procedures in connection with making a section 117E agreement;
procedures in connection with varying or terminating a section 117E agreement;
the terms and conditions of a section 117E agreement, including terms as to the duration of such an agreement;
principles for determining the terms and conditions that should or should not be incorporated into a section 117E agreement.

P2para.Text: A code may make provision about the steps to be taken by the Authority in determining for the purposes of section 117E(2) whether a sewerage undertaker is, in the particular case, required to perform a duty under sections 117A to 117D.

If the Authority considers that a sewerage undertaker or a sewerage licensee is not acting as required by a code, the Authority may give the undertaker or the licensee a direction to do, or not to do, a thing specified in the direction.
The Authority may not give a direction under subsection (4) requiring a person to enter into, vary or terminate an agreement.
It is the duty of a sewerage undertaker or a sewerage licensee to comply with a direction under subsection (4), and this duty is enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
A code may make—

P3para.Text: different provision for different persons or descriptions of person;
different provision for different duties under sections 117A to 117D.

P2para.Text: The Authority may from time to time review a code issued under this section and issue a revised code.
A revised code may include provision for applying any of its revisions to section 117E agreements made before the revised code comes into effect.
Before issuing a code under section 117F, the Authority must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed code under section 117F, and
consult persons in accordance with subsections (2) and (3).

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the appropriate agency;
the Council;
any sewerage undertakers likely to be affected by the proposed code;
any sewerage licensees likely to be affected by the proposed code;
such other persons as the Authority thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Authority must specify the period (“the consultation period”) within which a person may make representations about the proposed code.
Before a code under section 117F prepared by the Authority is issued for the first time, the Secretary of State may direct the Authority—

P3para.Text: not to issue the code, or
to issue the code with specified modifications.

P2para.Text: A direction under subsection (4) must be given within the period of 28 days beginning with the day after the end of the consultation period, and the code prepared by the Authority may not be issued before that period of 28 days has expired.
In this section “the appropriate agency” means—

P3para.Text: the Environment Agency, in relation to section 117E agreements made with sewerage undertakers whose areas are wholly in England;
both the Environment Agency and the NRBW, in relation to section 117E agreements made with sewerage undertakers whose areas are partly in England and partly in Wales.

P2para.Text: This section is subject to section 117H.

P1group.Title: Codes under section 117F: minor or urgent revisions

P2para.Text: This section applies if the Authority proposes to issue a revised code under section 117F and, in the view of the Authority, the revision or each of the revisions proposed to be made is—

P3para.Text: a revision for which consultation is unnecessary, or
a revision that it is necessary or desirable to make without delay.

P2para.Text: Section 117G does not apply to the proposed revised code.
Once the Authority has issued the revised code, it must give notice as soon as reasonably practicable of—

P3para.Text: the issuing of the revised code, and
as regards each revision contained in it, whether in the view of the Authority the revision falls within paragraph (a) or (b) of subsection (1).

P2para.Text: Notice under subsection (3) is to be given to such persons as the Authority considers appropriate.

Unless the Authority gives notice that a revision in a revised code is in the view of the Authority a revision falling within subsection (1)(a), the revision ceases to have effect at the end of the period of six months beginning with the day after that on which the revised code is issued.
The Authority must issue rules about charges that may be imposed by sewerage undertakers under a section 117E agreement.
The rules may in particular make provision about—

P3para.Text: the types of charges that may be imposed;
the amount or the maximum amount, or methods for determining the amount or maximum amount, of any type of charge;
principles for determining what types of charges may or may not be imposed;
principles for determining the amount of any charge that may be imposed.

P2para.Text: The rules must include provision for and in connection with requiring a sewerage undertaker to impose on a sewerage licensee only such charges as would enable the licensee, where the services it provides to a person under its retail authorisation are services to which a section 142(2)(b) agreement would apply if the undertaker had continued to provide the services, to charge for those services at the same rate or rates as would have applied if the section 142(2)(b) agreement had applied.
In subsection (3) “section 142(2)(b) agreement” means an agreement to which section 142(2)(b) applies.
If the Authority considers that a sewerage undertaker is not acting as required by rules under this section, the Authority may—

P3para.Text: give the undertaker a direction to do, or not to do, a thing specified in the direction, or

in a case where a section 117E agreement to which the undertaker is party requires modification in order to conform to the rules, give a direction to the undertaker and the sewerage licensee in question to modify the agreement.

P2para.Text: It is the duty of a sewerage undertaker or a sewerage licensee to comply with a direction under subsection (5), and this duty is enforceable by the Authority under section 18.
The rules may—

P3para.Text: make different provision for different persons or descriptions of person;
make different provision for different purposes;
make provision subject to exceptions.

P2para.Text: The Authority may from time to time review rules issued under this section and issue revised rules.
Revised rules may include provision for applying any of the revisions to section 117E agreements made before the revised rules come into effect.

P1group.Title: Rules about charges: provision about the reduction of charges

P2para.Text: Rules under section 117I may provide for the reduction of charges payable under a section 117E agreement where—

P3para.Text: a sewerage licensee that has a retail authorisation is party to the section 117E agreement, and
other conditions specified by the rules are satisfied.

P2para.Text: Rules made by virtue of subsection (1) may in particular—

P3para.Text: specify conditions relating to any party to the section 117E agreement;
specify conditions about persons taking steps for the purpose of reducing or managing demand for sewerage services;
specify conditions about the premises by reference to which such steps are to be taken;
specify conditions about reducing charges payable by a person who—

P4para.Text: is not party to the section 117E agreement, and
takes or proposes to take such steps as satisfy or would satisfy a condition specified under paragraph (b).

P2para.Text: The rules may provide that, where a charge falls to be reduced in accordance with rules made by virtue of subsection (1), the sewerage undertaker to which the charges are payable must give notice of that reduction to the Authority.
Rules made by virtue of subsection (3) may—

P3para.Text: make provision as to the content of the notice;
specify the period within which an undertaker is to give notice to the Authority.

P2para.Text: Provision under subsection (4)(a) may in particular require the notice to specify—

P3para.Text: the amount of the charge, with and without the reduction;
the period for which the reduction has effect.

P2para.Text: Before issuing rules under section 117I, the Authority must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed rules under section 117I, and
consult the relevant persons about the draft.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the appropriate agency;
the Council;
any sewerage undertakers likely to be affected by the proposed rules;
any sewerage licensees likely to be affected by the proposed rules;
such other persons as the Authority thinks appropriate.

P2para.Text: The Authority must specify the period (“the consultation period”) within which persons may make representations about the proposed rules.
The Authority must have regard to guidance issued under section 117L in making rules under section 117I.
Before rules under section 117I prepared by the Authority are issued, the Secretary of State may direct the Authority—

P3para.Text: not to issue the rules, or
to issue the rules with specified modifications.

P2para.Text: A direction under subsection (5) must be given within the period of 28 days beginning with the day after the end of the consultation period, and rules may not be issued before that period of 28 days has expired.
In this section “the appropriate agency” means—

P3para.Text: the Environment Agency, in relation to section 117E agreements made with sewerage undertakers whose areas are wholly in England;
both the Environment Agency and the NRBW, in relation to section 117E agreements made with sewerage undertakers whose areas are partly in England and partly in Wales.

P2para.Text: The Minister must issue guidance as to the content of rules under section 117I.
Before issuing the guidance, the Minister must—

P3para.Text: prepare a draft of the proposed guidance;
consult the relevant persons about the draft.

P2para.Text: The relevant persons are such persons as the Minister thinks fit.
The Minister may from time to time revise the guidance and issue revised guidance.
Subsections (2) and (3) apply to revised guidance as they apply to the original guidance.
The Minister must arrange for the publication of guidance issued under this section.
In this section “the Minister” means the Secretary of State.
Subsection (2) applies if at any time the Authority determines that the removal of matter from a sewerage undertaker’s sewerage system that the undertaker is required to permit under section 117C
or 117D in accordance with a section 117E agreement constitutes strategic sewerage provision.
The Authority must designate the removal of matter as strategic sewerage provision.
Subsection (4) applies if—

P3para.Text: a sewerage undertaker requests the Authority to make a determination that a particular removal of matter constitutes strategic sewerage provision for the purposes of subsection (1), or
the Authority otherwise proposes to make a determination that a particular removal of matter constitutes strategic sewerage provision for the purposes of subsection (1).

P2para.Text: The Authority must give notice of the request or proposed determination to—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the appropriate agency;
the other party or parties, or the parties, to the section 117E agreement; and
such other persons (if any) as the Authority thinks it appropriate to notify.

P2para.Text: A notice under subsection (4) must specify the time within which representations or objections with respect to the request or proposed determination may be made.
The time specified may not be less than 28 days from the date on which the notice was given.
The time specified may not be less than 28 days from the date on which the notice was given.
The Authority must consider any representations or objections which are duly made and not withdrawn.
If the Authority determines that a particular removal of matter designated under this section as strategic sewerage provision no longer constitutes such provision, it must cancel its designation.

If the Authority proposes to make a determination under subsection (7) that a particular removal of matter no longer constitutes strategic sewerage provision, it must give notice of the proposed determination to—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the appropriate agency;
the parties to the section 117E agreements in question.

P2para.Text: Subsection (5) applies to a notice under subsection (8) as it applies to a notice under subsection (4), and subsection (6) applies accordingly.

For the purposes of this section, a removal of matter from a sewerage system is strategic sewerage provision if, without that removal of matter, there is a substantial risk that the sewerage undertaker would be unable—

P3para.Text: to maintain its services to its own customers, and
to fulfil its obligations under section 117B to deal with matter in its sewerage system.

P2para.Text: In this section and section 117N “the appropriate agency”, in relation to a determination in respect of the removal of matter from a sewerage undertaker’s system, means—

P3para.Text: the Environment Agency, in a case where the undertaker’s area is wholly in England;
both the Environment Agency and the NRBW, in a case where the undertaker’s area is partly in England and partly in Wales.

P2para.Text: Subsection (2) applies if at any time the Authority determines that two or more cases of the removal of matter from a sewerage system—

P3para.Text: each of which is a removal by a sewerage licensee, and
each of which is a removal that a sewerage undertaker is required to permit under section 117C or 117D in accordance with a section 117E agreement,

P2para.Text: constitute collective strategic sewerage provision.
The Authority must designate the cases of the removal of matter as a collective strategic supply.
Subsection (4) applies if—

P3para.Text: a sewerage undertaker requests the Authority to make a determination that two or more cases of the removal of matter from a sewerage system constitute collective strategic sewerage provision for the purposes of subsection (1), or

the Authority otherwise proposes to make a determination that two or more cases of the removal of matter from a sewerage system constitute collective strategic sewerage provision for the purposes of subsection (1).

P2para.Text: The Authority must give notice of the request or proposed determination to—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the appropriate agency;
the other party or parties, or the parties, to the section 117E agreements in question; and
such other persons (if any) as the Authority thinks it appropriate to notify.

P2para.Text: A notice under subsection (4) must specify the time within which representations or objections with respect to the request or proposed determination may be made.
The time specified may not be less than 28 days from the date on which the notice was given.
The time specified may not be less than 28 days from the date on which the notice was given.
The Authority must consider any representations or objections which are duly made and not withdrawn.

If the Authority determines that the cases of the removal of matter from a sewerage system designated under this section as collective strategic sewerage provision no longer constitute such provision, it must cancel their designation.

If the Authority proposes to make a determination under subsection (7) that the cases of the removal of matter from a sewerage system no longer constitute collective strategic sewerage provision, it must give notice of the proposed determination to—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State;
the appropriate agency; and
the parties to the section 117E agreements in question.

P2para.Text: Subsection (5) applies to a notice under subsection (8) as it applies to a notice under subsection (4), and subsection (6) applies accordingly.

For the purposes of this section, two or more cases of the removal of matter from a sewerage system are collective strategic sewerage provision if, without those cases of the removal of matter, there is a substantial risk that the sewerage undertaker would be unable—

P3para.Text: to maintain its services to its own customers, and
to fulfil its obligations under section 117B to deal with matter in its sewerage system.

P1group.Title: Prohibition on unauthorised use of sewerage system

P2para.Text: No person may use the sewerage system of a sewerage undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England for the purpose of taking away matter discharged from the premises of—

P3para.Text: a customer,
the person so using that system, or
a person associated with that person.

P2para.Text: Subsection (1) is subject to subsections (3) and (4) and section 117Q.
Subsection (1) does not apply where that use of the system is made by—

P3para.Text: the sewerage undertaker, or
a sewerage licensee in pursuance of its sewerage licence.

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may by regulations specify further circumstances in which subsection (1) does not apply.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) is guilty of an offence.
An undertaking entered into which involves a contravention of subsection (1) is unenforceable.
A person guilty of an offence under this section is liable—

P3para.Text: on summary conviction, to a fine not exceeding the statutory maximum;
on conviction on indictment, to a fine.

P2para.Text: Proceedings for an offence under this section may not be instituted except by—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, or
the Authority.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this section, a person (A) is associated with another person (B) if they would be associated with each other for the purposes of Schedule 2B if A were a sewerage licensee.
In this section and sections 117P and 117Q, references to the sewerage system of a sewerage undertaker are to be construed in accordance with section 17BA(7).

P1group.Title: Prohibition on unauthorised removal of matter from sewerage system

P2para.Text: No person other than the undertaker may remove matter from the sewerage system of a sewerage undertaker whose area is wholly or mainly in England.
Subsection (1) is subject to subsections (3) and (4) and section 117Q.
Subsection (1) does not apply where —

P3para.Text: matter is removed by a sewerage licensee in pursuance of its sewerage licence, or
matter is removed by another sewerage undertaker under a main connection agreement (within the meaning of section 110B).

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may by regulations specify further circumstances in which subsection (1) does not apply.
An undertaking entered into which involves a contravention of subsection (1) is unenforceable.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) is guilty of an offence.
A person guilty of an offence under this section is liable—

P3para.Text: on summary conviction, to a fine not exceeding £20,000;
on conviction on indictment, to a fine.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of section 210, the penalty on conviction on indictment of an offence under this section is to be deemed to include imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years (in addition to or instead of a fine).
Proceedings for an offence under this section may not be instituted except by—

P3para.Text: the Secretary of State, or
the Authority.

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may by order made by statutory instrument grant exemption from section 117O(1) or 117P(1) to—

P3para.Text: a person or persons of a class;
generally or to such extent as may be specified in the order;
unconditionally or subject to such conditions as may be specified in the order.

P2para.Text: Before making an order under subsection (1), the Secretary of State must give notice—

P3para.Text: stating that the Secretary of State proposes to make such an order and setting out the terms of the proposed order;
stating the reasons why the Secretary of State proposes to make the order in the terms proposed; and
specifying the time (not being less than 28 days from the date of publication of the notice) within which representations or objections with respect to the proposals may be made,

P2para.Text: and must consider any representations or objections which are duly made and not withdrawn.
The notice required by subsection (2) is to be given—

P3para.Text: by serving a copy of it on the Authority, and
by publishing it in such manner as the Secretary of State considers appropriate for bringing it to the attention of those likely to be affected by the proposed order.

P2para.Text: Notice of an exemption granted to a particular person is to be given—

P3para.Text: by serving a copy of the exemption on the person, and
by publishing the exemption in such manner as the Secretary of State considers appropriate for bringing it to the attention of other persons who may be affected by it.

P2para.Text: Notice of an exemption granted to persons of a particular class is to be given by publishing the exemption in such manner as the Secretary of State considers appropriate for bringing it to the attention of—

P3para.Text: persons of that class, and
other persons who may be affected by it.

P2para.Text: An exemption may be granted—

P3para.Text: indefinitely, or
for a period specified in, or determined by or under, the exemption.

P2para.Text: The conditions that may be specified may, in particular, require any person carrying on any activity allowed by the exemption—

P3para.Text: to comply with any direction given by the Secretary of State or the Authority as to such matters as are specified in the exemption or are of a description so specified;

except in so far as the Secretary of State or the Authority consents to the person’s doing or not doing them, not to do or to do such things as are specified in the exemption or are of a description so specified;
to refer for determination by the Secretary of State or the Authority such questions arising under the exemption as are specified in the exemption or are of a description so specified.

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may by order made by statutory instrument revoke an order by which an exemption was granted to a particular person under section 117Q(1) or vary an order by which more than one exemption was so granted so as to terminate any of the exemptions—

P3para.Text: at the person’s request,
in accordance with any provision of the order by which the exemption was granted, or
if it appears to the Secretary of State inappropriate that the exemption should continue to have effect.

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may by order made by statutory instrument revoke an order by which an exemption was granted to persons of a particular class under section 117Q(1) or vary an order by which more than one exemption was so granted so as to terminate any of the exemptions—

P3para.Text: in accordance with any provision of the order by which the exemption was granted, or
if it appears to the Secretary of State inappropriate that the exemption should continue to have effect.

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may by direction withdraw an exemption granted to persons of a particular class under section 117Q(1) from any person of that class—

P3para.Text: at the person’s request,
in accordance with any provision of the order by which the exemption was granted, or
if it appears to the Secretary of State inappropriate that the exemption should continue to have effect in the case of the person.

P2para.Text: Before making an order under subsection (1)(b) or (c) or (2) or giving a direction under subsection (3)(b) or (c), the Secretary of State must—

P3para.Text: consult the Authority, and
give notice—

P4para.Text: stating that the Secretary of State proposes to make such an order or give such a direction,
stating the reasons why the Secretary of State proposes to make such an order or give such a direction, and
specifying the time (not being less than 28 days from the date of publication of the notice) within which representations or objections with respect to the proposals may be made,

P2para.Text: and must consider any representations or objections which are duly made and not withdrawn.
The notice required by subsection (4)(b) is to be given—

P3para.Text: where the Secretary of State is proposing to make an order under subsection (1)(b) or (c), by serving a copy of it on the person to whom the exemption was granted;

where the Secretary of State is proposing to make an order under subsection (2), by publishing it in such manner as the Secretary of State considers appropriate for bringing it to the attention of persons of the class of persons to whom the exemption was granted;
where the Secretary of State is proposing to give a direction under subsection (3)(b) or (c), by serving a copy of it on the
person from whom the Secretary of State proposes to withdraw the exemption.

P2para.Text: A statutory instrument containing—

P3para.Text: an order under subsection (1) or (2), or
an order under section 117Q(1),

P2para.Text: is subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament.
